All of the buns were bizarre but flavorful from the pork belly ones to the two kinds we had for dessert (the 'crispy creamy' and the 'sweet egg yolk'). The server we had was cool and so were the interiors.  Oh, I forgot to mention the soup dumplings. I'd never had them before, and I'm in love. Ours were filled with pork and crab. Awesome. Go.

NMM8Kz07PZU_AnP-GkpbcQ.text: I come from Taiwan, the food here really made me think of my hometown. Delicious! We ordered chicken noodle, fried vegetable, soup dumplings and pearl milk tea. The taste was really local and great.  Also we met the restaurant owner there. We chat for a while and he was really nice. He asked if the foods are OK and changed a new bubble milk tea for us when he knew we thought the tea was too sweet.  Although the prices here are higher than average, I still think it's a really good place to go.

IRS0TDhUAZkOMdXVhvUKNA.text: I really want to give Everyday Noodles one more star, but in the end I cannot because I honestly don't think that their food is worth the price. That said, their food is really comforting. I've tried many of their noodle dishes, including braised beef, beef tendon, oxtail, pork rib, dan dan mian, and more. The noodles and broth are very good (not too salty like many other places make their noodles), and the meat is delicious and tender. In addition, good things can be said about their small dishes, including the pancake dessert and potstickers.  But EN, just WHY must your prices be so high? I would be happy if they were actually a lot more authentic like some of the stuff that Rose Tea serves across the street, but most of what they do are well-intended imitations at best. I would also be happy if the quantity matched the price, but the amount of noodles and vegetables don't come close to the noodles served by Taiwan or Szechuan Express in Oakland (the meat is better at least). I really don't find a bowl of $11 noodles worth it when I can get a slightly lower quality bowl but with a more authentic feel at Sichuan Gourmet for half the price.  As much as I hate to mention it, this place is much more gentrified than the aforementioned ones. It caters to American customers more so than the others (rather than Chinese students), which is why it is justified in their pricing choices. I would come here once in a while if I'm craving some comfort food in addition to maybe a dim sum or two, but normally I'd probably go and spend a few bucks more for a much more ethnic dish at Rose Tea or Sichuan Gourmet.

g2SHot2iHEQRJrtX7owMqA.text: This place is great, and definitely worth the wait to be seated. (I suggest waiting by the window and watching the noodles get made.) The pork soup dumplings were delicious, and the sweet egg yolk buns tasted like sugar cookie dough.

0Tx5MPOCWDrk6JdtDuX_ew.text: Mmmmmm! Easily the best bubble tea at a decent price. You get two toppings plus tapioca for a large size. Whenever I eat here, I always get one to drink with my meal even if I'm not that hungry.  Their pork soup dumplings are wonderfully tasty. They usually give you ginger, soy sauce, vinegar, and hot sauce to pair with them.  Another delicious dish to get is the braised beef and tendon noodle soup. The meat is so juicy and tender, and the soup is full of flavor. For noodles, I strongly suggest getting their wide noodles over the thin by the way.  There are a few large tables, so it's also a good place for larger parties of 4+ (and as long as you don't go during peak hours you won't have to wait too long for a table).

x49FZJU8ffcs3Uth4Uqy2A.text: Excellent flavors at fair prices. Speedy service. Highly recommend.  I had no. 41 ($7), a toothsome heap of noodles with minced pork sauce and a nice balance of flavors. The taste was definitely not as salty as other variations I've eaten before. Bonus points.  No. 3 ($5), wood ears with tofu skins and cilantro, is a light dish with special flavor.   This restaurant is well-managed. The staff really are "in the zone." You really get a sense of how focused the cooks are as you watch them constantly prepare an endless supply of noodles and dumplings by hand behind the counter. Waiters are busy either picking up new orders or delivering checks to customers. They're almost too fast! On the one hand my dishes arrived no more than five minutes after I placed my order.  On the other hand, both plates arrived at the same time. I wish I would have received my "appetizer" first. Some may find the service to be a little curt, but at least you won't feel tempted to over-tip ;)  Nevertheless, the food is what really matters for me. I'm determined to eat my way through Everyday Noodles, one blob of dough at a time.

QMrzy40WZ0yVX0rXaXoODg.text: This is probably the best Chinese restaurant in Pittsburgh.  Fantastic food all-around.  I've had virtually everything on the menu.  Their soup dumplings are delicious - especially the Sunday Loofah special.  Obviously the noodles are good (I prefer the thin noodles).  And the soups were really really good.  Plus the service is great.  Food comes out quick (within 5 minutes) and the staff is helpful, attentive, and nice.  I can't recommend this place more.  Having lived in Pittsburgh for 4 years now, this was the Chinese restaurant that I've been searching for so very glad they opened.

QmS1nrs4l6AvHfxzgcMjmA.text: Okay this may sound over the top but my first restaurant experience here was magical! Why? Soup Dumpling! How in the world have I lived my life up to this point without ever knowing about or trying soup dumplings before? It was just one of those foods that changed EVERYTHING for me. I have been here several times since then and it is always top notch, consistent, modern, clean, and fun. It is always great for my kids to watch when they are making the noodles. I have tried their soup dumplings, spicy noodles ( I forget exactly what they are called), pork belly buns, and pork potstickers. Everything is honestly so good. Parking can be difficult sometimes but if you pull around to the back there is usually parking back there if there is no luck on the main street. This restaurant is the best Asian restaurant I have ever been to. My mother patiently waited a year to come back to this place when we went a few days back. I have also taken my in-laws. I always recommend this place to friends around here. This might just be my favorite place in Pittsburgh.

UBrnjuJO5UcvYpGSxZSwGg.text: Not much more to be said other then I really enjoy the noodles here.  I recommend getting the dumplings with soup in the middle.  Service was prompt.  Never had a bad item on the menu.

Yh-VibobZe6COSM9XWKO2Q.text: What can I say?   Everything is amazing.  I haven't had one thing I don't like.  The spicy wonton noodles are my favorite.  The potstickers are to die for.

B3AUZNcvjAW-v5FagSuE_Q.text: This place was incredible! Sat at the bar right in front of the talented people creating homemade noodles and dumplings. Authentic, and delicious. I ordered the braised beef noodle soup and it was by far the best Ramen I have had! Food came out quickly, and portions are large. Also ordered pork dumplings which are out of this world. Great atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Braised Beef Noodle Soup

W_qFklNeenpBYEz4nYgJtw.text: This was my first time trying Everyday Noodles and it was a cool experience. I loved that they were making the dumplings right in front of you so you know it's fresh! There were only about two vegetarian options so I didn't have much to choose from but I got the veggie dumplings and they were delicious. I was disappointed you could only get the veggie soup dumplings on Sunday but I will definitely come back on Sunday to try them out!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

xQZyofnNpbKA2V0_pY6hIg.text: My first night in the new apartment I wasn't about to go buy groceries.  Everyday Noodles was close and pretty cheap, and my roommate was cool with it.  I'm super glad I tried this place out, and I will totally be back.  Our server was quick, efficient, and gave me a bunch of recommendations, which was awesome.  She recommended the spicy wonton noodles with flour (thin) noodles.  At $7, this was beyond worth it.  The portion was massive, and the spicy was good but not overwhelming.  I made two and a half meals out of the portion.  I also split the vegetable soup dumplings ($9) with my roommate, and I really enjoyed them.  If you're on a budget, they are pricey compared to the portion vs some of the other options.  But I really enjoyed the dumplings so if you aren't counting pennies, definitely try them!  This place gets busy, but there is quite a bit of seating packed into the store.  It is rather crowded, but they can't help that their food is good!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Black milk bubble tea w/ mango pudding and red bean... $4.50
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegetable soup dumplings... $9
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hot Spicy Wonton Noodles... $7

ZkGsulRjwuihA5L5MPxKGQ.text: Soup dumpling is the best. Better than all of the dim sum places I've been

Em_ANb7_IN498hLPqz6BQw.text: Always delicious and consistent!  Fair prices, very fast service. Couldn't want anything more!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef tendon soup with wide flour noodles. Never a miss when I&#39;m here!
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork soup dumplings
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Always delicious pork belly slider!

s8bGYotJBHcXU-uvW3EwSw.text: This place is definitely about the noodles, and they are definitely first class.  The dumplings are also excellent.    What everyone should realize is Everyday Noodles is Taiwanese cuisine, so although it may not meet your expectations, if you are open to discovering what they have to offer on their own terms, you will be pleasantly surprised.  My waiter was extremely helpful in guiding me through the menu and suggesting dishes that would appeal to me.  The portions are generous, and the noodles are comfort food heaven.  I love the decor, it's rather sophisticated and well designed.  This place is a great find.  I'm ending with a tip.  Try the Sweet Egg Yolk Steamed Bun.  It comes with 3 steamed buns, so very appropriate for sharing, and oh so delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sesame Rice Ball.  Toasted and hot from the oven.
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork Soup Dumplings

6_3KgIDB-SZ0v8Rg6LiwQQ.text: A solid 4. The food was great but every dish had a little bit they could improve on.   We ordered the pork belly in a bao, pork soup dumplings, the shrimp and pork wontons, noodles with their peanut sauce, and their bubble teas.   The wontons are made fresh and they're yummy. We saw the lady wrapping it at the table. The pork belly had the authentic flavors but the pork was dry and they used way too much parsley.   The soup dumplings were yummy but they should have left the steamer lid on. They got cold very fast. The noodles with peanut sauce was very rich and savory. We had it with the thick noodles.   The bubble tea is pretty close to authentic. It taste better than a lot of places I've tried and you can taste the real tea flavor.   The service was a little slow. We sat down and we're ignored for about ten mins. No water. No greeting. Nothing.   Overall a nice place. A little pricey but the food was yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lady wrapping fresh wontons
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork belly in a bao
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork soup dumplings

IRUfBlrmAneMJueDMIo07w.text: I haven't had any proper noodles in quite a while since I left my home town. Since I entered Pittsburgh, I haven't had the time, nor the money to afford this oriental commodity. Now that I do, I will tell you: It was worth the wait.   When I walked in, I was immediately met with great service and seating. I actually quite liked the checklist type of menu. As was looking through their menu, I kept hearing a loud noise behind me but paid it no mind, of course, that was until it continued for the next 5 minutes. Finally I gave into my irritation and curiosity and turned around. To my surprise, I saw a crew of cooks making the noodles from scratch. And the noise that was being made was the sound of the dough being worked on, then solidified with a whip-like slam. To add to the excitement, there was a table right next to the window where they were cooking so those seated there were able to watch them make theor food. My irritation immediately turned into admiration.   The waitress was was very kind and informative. I ordered the Shrimp and Pork Wonton Noodle Soup, as well as the San Dan Noodles Szechuan Style as she recommended. I like the fact that I was given the option of the classic thin noodles or the fat and flat style. Personally, I prefer the classic thin because the larger noodle has a harder time retaining the flavor as the smaller one.  My order came to my table about 3 minutes after ordering, so I really appreciated the instant service. However, one could be reasonably skeptical if your food was made that fast as some may ask: What about the quality of the food? And to answer that, I have placed my thoughts on each dish below.  Shrimp and Pork Wonton Noodle Soup: The broth was the first thing that I tasted, which later would  also bring the whole dish together. It was light - which I and all of those who have exercised after a meal would appreciate - yet still managed to keep its flavor. The noodles were standard but still done well. As for the wontons, or dumplings as some may call it, they were good. Nothing to write home about, but still good enough to not be a soggy distraction in my bowl as most other establishments fall victim to. This was a very refreshing dish and I enjoyed it thoroughly.  San Dan Noodles Szechuan Style:  Same as last, the first thing I tasted was the broth(sauce?). I liked how they capitalized on the sesame flavor. It was spicy and savory, but neither overpowered the other. As for the noodles, they mixed well with the broth but I feel as though I definitely should have gotten the thinner noodles for this one. Still, the balance of this dish was excellent and allowed me to enjoy 2 different flavors equally. Note: This dish is pretty spicy(not actually though), so beware.  Final Judgements:  There was one moment particularly  that stuck in my head: I completed one meal and wanted to box the other, so I took out my wallet and began to look around. My actions were immediately met with exactly what I wanted, and no words were ever uttered from my mouth. That basically sums up what my experience was in this establishment. What I wanted was a quick, good quality, economically reasonable place to eat noodles, and I got it.  I am not a noodle coneseur, but when it comes down to it, I have been around the block. And for that, my personal rating on it is 4 stars. However, as the fellow common man consumer, it does more than satisfy me, so I will give it a 5 stars.   Anyone In the squirrel hill area? Give this restaurant a try!

fbvlyeQ2sIXwi3uSNU1Ofw.text: I used to enjoy Everyday Noodles until a recent mortifying experience. I ordered take out - soup dumplings & chicken noodle soup. The dumplings were fine, the soup was inedible (filled with lots of small bugs). Everyday Noodles used to be a go to, but after this I will not be going back. If you eat here, proceed with caution.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bugs in soup.
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bugs in soup.

YCVD2Tipxamj92EAPdovHw.text: Amazing! We ate here on our first night in Pittsburgh - by the end of the day we decided to move across the country. Everyday Noodles helped seal the deal.   We had the dan dan noodles and the cold sesame noodles - both managed to be comfort food but not boring in the slightest. The potstickers are a must try - made in house and delivered as one large sheet to be divided up.  My boyfriend hates onions and even he enjoyed them despite scallions in the filling.   Will definitely be eating here regularly.

tqQMlvdJRwWidF4KGdNSCg.text: Incredible food! I'd recommend the dumplings and the Thai Boba Tea! Also the green onion pancake was amazing with their chilli sauce! I would most definitely come back!

h8jv91TCdSZEjK94SJdVzg.text: Not impressed by this place at all. The flavors were lacking on everything we tried and there's really no good vegetarian options here. There also nothing for kids. I'd never go back.

0k8oPo_MCKwQcevR6l0Qug.text: The noodles here are made fresh daily in front of you.  This is rare in most restaurants and you can actually watch them as you come in.  The dining area is small and fills up quick the food is authentic but it is pricey for what you are paying for especially with several asian eateries around the area. But the soup noodles are always good and the steamed pork soup dumplings are very good as well as the beef tendon noodle soup

qvg_7F9hdZd5tIWdbl_pcg.text: I have dined at Everyday Noodles twice and I have to say my first experience was a lot different from the second.   The first time, my mom and I ordered the shrimp and pork wonton soup to share! You got 8 wontons in a big bowl which is perfect for sharing.  For my meal, I ordered the Dan Dan noodles and my mom ordered the hot and spicy wonton noodles. I really really liked the Dan Dan noodles! It was a bit spicy but nothing I couldn't handle.   The second time I ordered take out. I ended up getting the pork soup dumplings and the hot and spicy wonton noodles. I had high hopes for the soup dumplings because I heard a lot of great things about them. Sadly I wish I could say I liked them, but I didn't. The pork inside did not look cooked at all and did not taste cooked. So I threw the dumplings out. There also wasn't a lot of soy sauce inside the dumplings. I would have to say that the soup dumplings I have ordered at jimmy wans taste a lot better and have more soy sauce in them, which I like! The only thing is you get 4 soup dumplings at JWs instead of the 8 at Everyday Noodles. For my meal I ordered the hot and spicy wonton noodles. The title says it all, this dish was extremely spicy! I definitely prefer the Dan Dan noodles over this.   I would come back to dine here because I would like to try some other dishes, but I know I wont be getting the soup dumplings. The pricing is extremely reasonable and you really do get a lot of food!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dan Dan Noodles and Hot Spicy Wonton Noodles

-R91IGEoRy761uVpwNoXJA.text: We stopped here for dinner today since we are in town visiting, and I wasn't sure what to expect. When we walked in, there was a window peering into the kitchen where a cook was rolling out the dough (is it called dough?) to make homemade noodles! I instantly got excited. They make all of their noodles in house, fresh.. which I didn't even know. I ordered the oxtail noodle soup and an order of pork soup dumplings to share. The noodle soup had a basic, but flavorful broth and I ordered the thin noodles.. you could tell from the soft, slight chewiness that the noodles were homemade and the oxtail meat was fall-off-the-bone, which is how it should be. It also had a fiew pieces of cooked broccoli, radish, and ginger in it, which was a nice touch.  Then there were the soup dumplings... o.m.g. These were the BOMB. They had so much flavor and the dumpling wrapping was delicious as well. The side of fresh, julienned ginger went perfectly with them. To finish off the meal, I had a black milk tea with red beans and grass jelly and it was a-mazing. I could tell it was real tea and not a powder mix.  So if you're in town and want to try a unique restaurant, I would definitely go here if you want some authentic Chinese food. The service was also extremely fast.. it came out in a little over 5 minutes of ordering! What?! Now that's some great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oxtail noodle soup, pork soup dumplings, and black milk tea.

Gt5xVctZiwobfnPDuiW1bw.text: Dumplings!! OMG the dumplings! I can't get enough of them. When I leave I feel like a dumpling because I can't stop eating them. I highly recommend the dumplings!!

E2Hibe8L0kEmJwTxz5n2BQ.text: stopped in E.N. for the first time this week while visiting the 'burgh.  ordered dan dan noodles with the wide noodles and chinese watercress with oyster sauce.  thought the noodles were fine, but the peanut sauce was just too salty.  actually mixed the greens into my noodle dish for more oomph.  green tea was infused with jasmine (yuk) which i didn't know at the time i ordered.  service was good but noodlehead is soooo much better!  take a pass.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

3H8VFro4UOnyoyIydzPcIg.text: Pork soup dumplings are certainly the star here as they arrived steaming hot and were delicious. Salty, flavorful broth, and my favorite part of the meal.  I went with the braised beef soup bowl which I had mixed feelings about. The broth itself was perfectly balanced, just could've used a little more heat. I went with the wide noodles, and as unique as the experience is of them being made in house, they didn't leave a lasting impression. Good, not great. The beef itself had so many tendons and a lot of fat which made it hard to chew let alone stomach.  We also had the broccoli with minced pork sauce which was disappointing. The pork had an "off" jerky taste, and we barely ate any of it.  We'd definitely come back to try some other dishes as they have your food out to you in about 5 minutes.

AcRs7KahXQ8ldzuw2biadw.text: It's fun to see them make the noodles as long as it isn't freaking out a young child. Take out is easy and consistent. Try the soup dumplings and the Szechuan style noodles.

8ST9hVCfosu-8EpdJ-1ePA.text: My daughter and I both ordered noodle soup and one order of steamed dumplings. The beef noodle soup was okay but a dead bee in my daughter's first bowl and an eyelash in her second bowl spoiled our dinner since I assumed the dead bee was probably in the pot that my soup was from. The steamed dumplings were more mushy than juicy as though they were undercooked. I am giving a second star because the waitress was very good and we were given  a 10 percent discount for the dead bee.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dead bee

dSxRN0jqBiByq9mBJziyyw.text: Most folks come here for the soup dumplings and the noodle soups. But really, any dish on the menu is a gem. For a family of four, I'll order tofu nuggets, five spiced egg plant, and marinated beef shank to start. Appetizers are easy to share and my toddler especially loves the tofu and eggplant dishes. Sometimes we'll each order a noodle entree and it will be more than enough food. I recommend eating the soup dumplings with their chili paste sprinkled on top.   On the weekend, be prepared for a bit of a wait as the dining area is small. If you get to sit by the window and watch the chefs make the noodles and dumplings, go for it!

w8ubXwkklBgbi79PevLO4A.text: I stopped in here during a visit to Pittsburgh. I am a sucker for fresh noodles and you don't get more fresh than someone banging out the noodles that will eventually end up on your plate right in front of you. Scared my poor niece every time they hit the large ropes of dough against the counter, she buried her head in my arm every time! (but I will take the cuddles when I can).   Atmosphere aside, the dishes were authentic and delicious. They have a pretty extensive menu, but it's called "Everyday Noodles" so unless you are a regular, you are foolish not to choose a noodle dish. Seriously, skip the rice, go straight for the noodles!!!  Food Suggestions: Dan Dan Noodles if you like spicy, Taiwanese Style Dan Tsu Noodles if you don't. Side of wonderfully steamed baby bok choy and if you are with a group, share some dim sum. I especially enjoyed the  pork and vegetable potstickers.   If you have room for dessert, which I always do, try the sweet egg yolk steamed bun. I have been looking for this ever since I left Singapore and this is a pretty good imitation!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sunday lunch with sister, Gigi and niece. Fantastic Dan Dan Noodles and steamed bok choy!

He1W7DUulaOHZngpn8lbtQ.text: Right when you walk in, I love the T Shirts the staff are wearing as it resembled their love for noodles:) I also enjoy the ambiance and the clear glass windows that illustrates how the dough is being made. I especially especially love the one staff that is super buff and all he does is throws the dough in the air so it fluff out and he just pretty much repeats this process. Anyhow ~ was for the food I thought everything was very wisely priced. And my favorite was the lamb soup it had lots of meat and goji berries. I also like the steamed soup dumplings . But the Dan Dan noodle was a pure disappointment due to the extreme overloading of the peanut butter sauce . The sauce was so over powering that it completely ruined the taste of the hand pulled noodles.   I also thought the service was a little too "Asian" as the check came to us without even us asking for the check. Almost felt like they wanted to rush us out ASAP.   Oh the wonton with the chili oil !! That was another disappointment so if you go; stick with the soup dumplings :) can't go wrong with the staples of this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dan Dan Noodle !! More like noodle with peanut butter ~ &#34;not&#34; recommended.
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu menu menu :) very reasonably priced
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lamb Soup !! Get this because you&#39;ll be amazed with the flavor.

CZCnQCnYfnZXpOWCl7lUHA.text: Everyday Noodles is pretty much always packed and for good reason. From watching the noodles being made from scratch to the delicious pork soup dumplings, you are guaranteed a fulfilling dining experience.  I've been several times and there's always a wide variety of dishes to choose from. Personally, I am a huge fan of the pork soup dumplings - which I definitely recommend trying at least once. They are served piping hot and can be best described as savory, filling, and comforting.   Service is reliably fast for a sit-down restaurant. Although the wait to be seated could be around 20 mins on a busy weekends, being located in the middle of Squirrel Hill means you can easily take a quick walk around the block and check out some of the neighborhood boutiques, etc.

8G3AJW1fhT8cvBlQ4Qf35g.text: Everyday Noodles has quickly become a family favorite with even the preschooler loving the noodles. Come for delicious noodles and dim sum favorites.

jYBqTkueYkan1LiNxsGxTw.text: I'm a sucker for fresh noodles and this place really hits the spot. I got the dry thick noodles with pork sauce. I loved the chewy noodles but I wished that there was more sauce and more pork because the dish felt a bit dry. Luckily the taro bubble tea helped out a bit.   Overall, this place was good and a great place to check out.

AuJsG8MfepHroZc1oOTWEw.text: I have been to every day noodles twice now and while the second experience was better than the first I am still giving this restaurant three stars. The first time I went we were seated next to the cooks making the noodles. While it is nice to know they make the noodles in house and they are fresh, the noise they made was something else. I left the restaurant with a headache after listening to incessant pounding practically the entire meal.   The second time I went they were making buns meaning my experience was much better and quieter. I ordered the Dan Dan noodles and my wife orders buns. The noodles were a bit bland and the sauce was not as spicy as I generally prefer. The food was good, but I would not go out of my way to come back. This is a place for good fresh buns, but since that is not really my favorite food this restaurant is probably not the best fit for me.

jBUMaz3JtznsyuFHyWOtcg.text: I got the chicken soup consumme.  It was good but a little bland.  Super filling though!  Soup dumplings were good, but a little small compared to other places I've been.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Noodle Soup Consomme
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork Soup Dumplings (8)

UOGdZ1TZlFyPuegDkdQ3dA.text: I've been here at least five times and it has become my to-go place whenever I want some good noodles.   The service is amazing and the food always comes out pretty fast. I've tried a variety of their menu items and I can say my favorites are the Braised Beef Noodle Soup, Shrimp Pork Wonton Soup, or the Dan Dan Noodles. You get to choose the wide or thin noodles (get the wide ones, trust me!)   Their dim sum items are delicious as well. If it's your first time coming here, get their famous pork and vegetable potstickers! I honestly think it tastes pretty authentic.  It gets a little busy sometimes but the wait is definitely worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork and Vegetable Potstickers
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pan Fried Green Onion Pancake

OFqc5HRUNhj6qNbS7D2-Dg.text: Came in here twice in week when I was having extreme xiaolongbao (soup dumpling) cravings and they didn't disappoint! We had 2 steaming servings along with pickled cucumbers, dan dan noodles, tofu skin, and pan fried pork buns. Everything was pretty tasty, but not exactly authentic per se. The dan dan noodles were drenched in a sesame-based sauce, which is a far cry from the chili oil it's typically served with. That being said - we still did finish every last noodle in the bowl...  If you want a meal and a show (AKA hand-pulling of the noodles or making the dumplings), make sure to sit in front of the big glass window near the front of the restaurant!

KO8o4nk584JJJhJI5wva4A.text: Great noodle shop in the Squirrel Hill area of Pittsburg! Very authentic with a good selection of noodles and dim sum items. The milk tea was also a great option with boba plus 2 toppings of your choice included in the price. I got the thai tea, which tasted a bit watery, but all in all, was a great deal for the price. For food, I ordered the traditional beef noodle soup and enjoyed the hearty bowl of noodles. Good amount of beef accompanied the noodles, and the soup was very flavorful, but not overly so.   They were busy when I came on a weekday evening, but not so busy that they were completely full. Good amount of seating, including some long benches and a round table in the back. Service was excellent, I was greeted promptly upon entering and staff checked in with me throughout the meal. Food and drinks were also served quite quickly. They also do takeout, so that's also an option, but noodle soup is definitely best enjoyed in house. All in all, happy I found this place while wandering around and I can definitely have Everyday Noodles everyday :)

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef noodle soup, wide noodles - $11
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Thai milk tea with mango pudding and grass jelly - $4.50
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Back of menu

TRtwZ5yc5iQPSbgiyRlLog.text: I'd like to specify that I'm only reviewing the bubble tea experience and what I saw while Inside. I was in the area and wanted some bubble tea, went to a place across the street and they said that they were out of tapioca balls so I ended up here. My first thought walking in was how cool it was watching the noodles be made. Actually watching everything be made. Another thing I noticed was the cleanliness, it all seemed extremely clean and very well kept.   I ordered a Thai tea bubble tea. It was pretty standard and good no issues with it. However I really respect that they use plastic film Instead of lids. The straw pushes right through and less plastic being used (obviously it's still in a plastic cup but still, there's effort) it also was a pretty good size compared to other bubble teas. I will definitely come back and order food.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

5SlwHnj1fwu2jjfCyZUtJQ.text: My last meal in Pittsburgh and WOW was I glad I saved this place for last! It really ended my vacation on a high note! Ordered the pork soup dumplings (omg yes I would like seven of these orders RIGHT NOW), the  green onion pancake (delicious) and my entree the hot and spicy wonton noodle (not very spicy but still incredibly good). I stained my shirt with sauce because I was being so greedy and wanted to try everything, thats how good this place was, haha. Definitely returning next time I am in the area!

x1DZ29uoB6Ltwls9HPTAsg.text: I just moved to Pittsburgh and my high school friend in town took me to this restaurant specialized in Taiwanese noodles. I'm really impressed.  I had the classic braised beef noodles: beef was tender and flavorful, noodles were freshly hand-made behind the counter, and the soup base was not full of MSG. My friend and I shared the five-spice eggplant and the steamed vegetable dumplings. Both dishes were tasty without being greasy.   Everyday Noodles exceeded my expectation and I'll definitely come back for noodles and steamed dishes and try out other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegetable Dumplings (8) steamed
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Braised Beef Noodle Soup
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggplant

thMjodzvCnZQ2dlJGdu4Zg.text: Loved this place. We both got dumplings and a bubble tea. Good portion sizes and great price.  Would definitely go back! Look forward to it

AdBJxWwQWXw-CMifnxuJOA.text: Clean, bustling restaurant with solid Taiwanese dishes! Came here around 7:30 and waited a solid 45 minutes before we were able to be seated. Fortunately, service here is REALLY FAST and our first dish came out within 5 minutes of ordering. We got the braised beef noodle soup, bok choy with oyster sauce, pork soup dumplings, and minced pork noodles (zhajiangmian). Everything was really good. You can choose either thin or thick noodles - we got thin for both and it was pretty good.  Beef noodle soup - definitely hits the spot when you're having a craving. Large pieces of beef and good broth (just slightly bland for my taste) I was surprised to see broccoli in my bowl though as I'm more accustomed to bok choy.  Bok choy - not much to report here. Good serving size and you have the option of either pork or oyster sauce. Server recommends oyster sauce.  Minced pork noodles - this was amazing. It reminded me so much of home and the ratio of noodle to toppings was perfect. This is not the sweet kind of bean sauce FYI and make sure you mix this thoroughly! I will definitely order again.  Soup dumplings - did not have high expectations for this to be honest but these were actually very good! They're on the smaller side but the peels were thin enough to not be overly chewy and still thick enough that they don't break easily. Comes with the vinegar sauce and optional ginger (I recommend). So good and glad that there's a good soup dumplings place in Pittsburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Braised Beef Noodle Soup and Noodles with Minced Pork Sauce
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Baby Bok Choy
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork soup dumplings

ycuZ8Vsfg5RqBV3zL3SXRA.text: The review was raving so we thought we may enjoy it. Five of ordered all different dishes from beef noodles, pork buns, sesame noodle, pork with rice and multiple appetizers. The sesame noodle was good, so was the port bun. But the beef noodle was flavorless. The soup base tasted more like flavor water, instead of broth.

8VT1ZrMderi3Z8ryzCs6cQ.text: Enjoyed the dumplings.. they are really good. Definitely try this place out! Service is good as well.

USFYkNOaOiKTQ2s-Dp_ZPQ.text: First experience of authentic Asian food since I moved here. Fantastic staff and fast service. This is great price for great food. The two pork belly sliders were flavorful and the added pickled lettuce completes the umami flavor. The soup dumplings have a thin skin and lots of soup. Noodles are bouncy and made to order.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Homemade noodles by slam chef. Technique makes the noodles bouncy!!
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork Soup Dumplings (8)
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Braised Beef Noodle Soup

796Ps6we6JptJW6eitKYLQ.text: The place was busy (but not overcrowded) on a Friday night.  My boyfriend and I ordered three dishes to share:   Dan Dan Noodles - I get excited every time I see dan dan noodles on a menu. This wasn't like the dan dan noodles I am used to. The sauce had a strong peanut and vinegar taste. It was strange...not bad, but unexpected.  Cold Noodles with Chicken - Good but not outstanding.  Pork Soup Dumplings - Really tasty!   Portions were large.   Cost was okay.  I want to go back and try the beef tendons!

Hbzo5j5nfeOBrVXTTU58CA.text: This place reminds me of Din Tai Fung. I got the Xiao Long Bao, Spicy Wonton Noodles, and Shao Mai. It was all good. It's neat to get to see them making the noodles while you sit and eat. This is probably your best bet if you want authentic Chinese food. I would like to go back at some point. Enjoy!

_pTE2uyJ5RcZZItZtgImZQ.text: Like many others have mentioned, this place is basically the Din Tai Fung of Pittsburgh, which in itself is already pretty impressive. Just the fact that you can get Xiao Long Bao in Squirrel Hill is exciting. Overall, the food is pretty good (but not *amazing*), and again, for Pittsburgh, this is a pretty good option for if you're craving Taiwanese food.

TjQurpTCyM8NDNscbKQzvA.text: I was excited about trying this place out, but I think I hyped this place up in my mind. Don't get me wrong, the place served decent food, it just didn't blow my mind away. Also if we are being honest, it was pricey...but I guess when you don't have competitors you can take advantage of that. I was very happy to hear from friends that a restaurant had finally opened serving fresh xiao long baos, yay the Midwest is finally catching up with the big cities! The food though was just ok. I felt the filling in the xiao long baos to be a bit too salty. I think I drank at least 3 cups of tea while eating them. The beef rolls were decent, and the beef noodle soup was ok. The beef was tender in the beef noodle soup, but I thought the soup base was nothing memorable. I've also rarely seen broccoli in traditional beef noodle soup, but I'm not really going to complain about that since I do love broccoli...but just a little different from what I've had before? I think I enjoyed the pork over rice dish the best out of everything I tried. In my opinion if they changed the filling of the xiao long baos I would totally come back just to eat those. That would be worth the two hour drive! Yes...when you're desperate you make that sort of crazy effort to fulfill your cravings...and no I'm not preggers...but just imagine if I was?!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

dQPsDnsAkjrLbpyUSVh_Kg.text: I have not had their food yet (the first few times I visited hoping to get takeout and they were not able to serve takeout yet) but I did get to try the bubble tea. I was happy to see that they have authentic bubble tea plus some interesting add-ons. I tried a black  tea plus coconut jelly and it was quite tasty. Their drinks are pricey, almost $5, but larger than other places that serve bubble tea. And it was tasty for sure!  The third time my husband visited to pick me up a bubble tea and they inexplicably added coffee to my black tea and kept insisting that was how it was made, which confused both of us. I asked for a green tea instead and they did replace it (though not happily). This version for some reason had rosewater in it, which also confused both of us.  It was NOT tasty that time, but I'll chalk it up to a new employee or something and likely get tea again in the future.  Looking forward to trying the food soon. One thing I did notice was that the sound of them slamming the homemade noodle dough on the marble slab was awfully jarring; I hope it's something that you get used to after being in their for a while! This feature probably makes it not the best place for sleeping infants though.

G9f-FeNezifH2MFfJ5nCmg.text: I had the golden fried tofu which was really tasty and then I had a chicken dish with cold sesame noodles in peanut sauce with sliced cucumbers which was pretty good too. For my drink I had Taro flavored Bubble Tea with Red Beans and I think diced mango which was very unique tasting and also very good.   Unfortunately I had just come back from playing basketball in extreme heat and my system was a little maladjusted. So it may not necessarily be the fault of the establishment that it fell short of 5 stars. However, relatively speaking I still find Raman Bar to be so far the best.  The service was friendly and some of the staff even bowed in staying with tradition and authenticity of the culture. I'd like to try this place again next time without preceding it with a rigorous workout in the heat of summer.

uyBUcWud2G0K3EAa_OZt8g.text: 3.5 stars!  Delicious and fun!   Soup dumplings very good, wonton dumpling noodle soup also good!  Noodles were very soft.  Dining partner got chicken noodle soup with whole pieces of bone-in chicken.   Beef soup very tasty, just a bit grissly.  A very nice surprise!  Will return to try more.

Zc99M_Kq2lvdAcgFUhtQ8g.text: Finally managed to get out to Everyday Noodles despite months of life interfering.   I would recommend it. I would go again. I did not fall head-over-heels in love like I imagined.  Ordering the Dan Dan Noodles and Pork Belly Slider, I had high hopes for the former and no expectations for the latter. Slider was out basically within seconds, noodles within 5 minutes.  The 'slider' was huge! It covered the entire plate. Inside was very tender, well seasoned, braised pork belly. Really good contrast with the fluffy steamed bun. $6 sounded like a lot, but it was a sandwich - not a slider.  For the main dish, the noodles are awesome. No joke, as good a noodle as you'll get. Sitting on the bench in front of the noodle maker is a nice treat when you're walking in for a 'table of one'.   It was the noodle soup that threw me off guard. First, I was not really expecting that much soup as these are, as advertised, 'dry' noodles. Not a big deal, but it 100% tasted like Sun Noodle's brand frozen Dan Dan Noodles. It was absolutely uncanny. I'm not suggesting that Everyday Noodles aren't making everything from scratch, clearly their noodles are.  Maybe Sun Noodles has cracked the code on ready-made broth. Who knows.  As I mentioned, I'd absolutely go again and recommend swinging by if you're looking for Taiwanese food.

pdruimF4Pbv5bJalVU1bAQ.text: A very enjoyable addition to the dining scene in Squirrel Hill, which has now become the hub for Asian food in the city.   The room is very nice (although the tables are quite close to one another), and was quite busy when we were there. The hosts and waiters were very friendly, and came to see us a few times. You can see the staff make the noodles, which is worth watching.  The food is tasty. We had the beef tendons noodle soup - the broth was tasty. The tendons were fat - as they should -  and very meaty. Not for every taste, but I liked it. The soup dumplings were good, although I have better ones.   The two appetizers - wood ears and tofu skin - and five spice eggplant, were fresh and light. We particularly enjoyed the tofu skin. A wonderful appetizer.   The food is a bit americanized - for instance, the szechuan dishes have the right taste, but are not very spicy. But in a good way: this is subtle and tasty.  Price-wise, this is also very reasonable. Be ready to wait, however.

-iy8Kiz9h1bb-lE4E9g-fQ.text: I can't believe I've lived in Squirrel Hill this long and haven't tried Everyday Noodles since last week. It was excellent!   My friend and I got a front row seat on the bench right in front of the window where the noodles and dumplings were being made. Sitting right there led to a bit louder experience than others since the chefs were throwing large slabs of dough (I won't ruin it for you all!) but it wasn't overly intrusive, just something to think about.  We started with the Soup Dumplings. I've never had soup dumplings in the past but these were unbelievable, definitely the highlight of the dinner. The dumplings were steaming hot, full of flavorful broth and well seasoned meat. The dumpling was a great texture, not too chewy, and it came with fresh ginger and soy sauce.  Next up was #46 Noodles with Minced Pork Sauce. That was a nice dish, smooth brown sauce with an almost smoky taste and minced pork served with wide noodles. It was not overly flavorful but simple and good. We also had the #38 Pan Fried Green Onion Pancake and while I don't usually eat onions alone, this was excellent. Crispy on the outside with great flavor (wasn't oniony in my opinion). We rounded out the dinner with some vegetables, Broccoli in the brown sauce.  All of this to say, this visit was a great first taste of what Everyday Noodles has to offer. I am definitely looking forward to going back in the future to explore more of their menu options!

XFepd1qEC-_x122LwHlnRA.text: We love everyday noodles and regularly order take out or delivery. Take out is great--ready for pick up in 15 minutes no matter how crowded. Delivery can take up to an hour on a busy Friday or Saturday. Eating there is nice too, but it's a little crowded and loud for my taste (especially with them making the noodles at the window, which is pretty loud).   From the menu:  You can't go wrong with any of the noodle soups--the freshly made noodles are wonderful. The beef from the beef noodle soup is melt in your mouth tender and, my personal favorite, the pork and shrimp wanton is very tasty. No matter what you get, the broth is always outstanding, and especially comforting on a cold day or if you are sick! Other recommendations include the soup dumplings and the steamed vegetables with the pork sauce.

0PdqkcNYfxfpQ4t1sbiFqQ.text: Menu is a scam. Mediocre taste. Next time I'd visit Ramen Bar right across the street.

O9ZZFZntXU2dqC7Frjutcg.text: Another great trip here.   So far my fav dish is the pork soup dumplings. Caution they come out so hot! Add a little soy sauce, poke open, then enjoy!   I had the Szechuan noodles dan Dan style with the thick noodles. Loved it and not too spicy. About a 5 on my scale.   Wife had the chicken noodle soup. She loved the broth and had the thin noodles. Chicken was fall off the bone tender but could use some better color. They looked a little plain but not a big deal. It's not chunks of chicken but normal chicken wings that you eat with hot sauce. But still was very good.   Server was great. Fast, friendly and made some good suggestions.   No complaints here. Would have loved to sit under the umbrella on Forbes but it rained. Only has three outside tables :(  See you again soon.

1axIHrqWeeNMmzn7cxVnMg.text: Definitely the most unique Asian restaurant I've been to! If you go with a group just order a bunch and share it family style. The food was delicious and the service was very fast. I recommend the braised pork, the soup dumplings, the Dan Dan noodles (a little spicy and peanutbuttery!), and absolutely get the egg buns for dessert! I would definitely go again! The portions are decent but not huge, and the prices are very reasonable!

SdLE25iVHwg9sKxPtFev7Q.text: I had read a little about this place and was pretty curious to check it out. We are pretty much novices to this style of asian cuisine but here is what we go and our impressions:  Pork Belly Sliders - well when I think of sliders I expect them to be really small. The portion was pretty big the issue was we just did not like the spices used to flavor it. It may be just something that you have to like to appreciate - for instance, I really just am not a fan of cilantro and there was a good bit of it on there as well as other spices we did not care for.   Wonton dry Noodles - Like others have mentioned - I was expecting a lot more noodle options - perhaps they will be expanding the option but you stick the word noodles in the name of your place and I expect to see more than four options. That said, this was the best thing we ate. The noodles were lovely and I loved the wonton dumplings. I was actually thinking about them the next day and really cannot wait to go back and get more!  Scallion pancakes - I have had these at a number of places and really love them. These were not my favorite. In fact, I prefer the ones across the street at rose tree cafe. My husband, however, really enjoyed them.   Would I go back? totally and plan to!

D6_5sDsI1lT6heLjXOnJ2A.text: Service was a bit "order, eat and get the fuck out so I can turn you table" but the food was pretty damn good. Oxtail in the oxtail soup was like butter. The soup dumplings rocked and the wood ear salad was impressive and delicious. Kitchen looked clean and professional but I wished they put the same care into cleaning the ac/heating unit on the wall above the dining area. The vents were full of gunk and dust and aimed right down on diners tables. That said, the food made up for the rest.

ZN3qTOcmfIKvzUkaUX31NQ.text: I just had incredibly mediocre soup dumplings at Everyday Noodles.There was almost no soup within the dumplings, the crab meat was virtually non-existent  (there was some pork),the dumplings were quite small and the dough envelope quite thick.This is not the place in Pittsburgh to go for soup dumplings!I'll keep looking though until I find soup dumpling paradise!

YOdS7sfOMRaEPWEoCbyVhQ.text: Definitely Awful place. I don't understand how its star earned. The noodle tastes so bad. I don't understand their attitudes. We came first but they offered seats to others. Is that because we have less group? But I don't think this is the reason we should be treated like this. This is my first time and also last time to eat here. Believe me, this is not a place you will get a great experience. Nobody is going out for having a bad taste and treat.

kWjc4Zk5K2yoAsUBEbXBXw.text: Best to go with a group -- have everyone order one thing off the menu, then share. It makes the experience more enjoyable, plus it saves on the cost of the food.

l4EI7gNc_AlK-OM4YEz5Xg.text: Very unprofessional treatment today. Called at 2:00 to make sure they delivered to our address and the person who answered said yes. Called at 5:00 and was told that they do not deliver to me despite the fact that I was told they do earlier and that their website advertises a 3 mile delivery radius and I live less than 3 miles away. Additionally the girl who put me on hold simply put the phone down on the counter so I could hear her saying disparaging things about me while I waited for her to get back to me. I'd recommend finding another place that values their customers. There are LOTS of them here in the Burgh!

KPoiPsiC0sMZxB_WcQoiWA.text: Love love love the soup dumplings here! He service is great too! Their other food is also very good - but the soup dumplings are special.

973ZLUWpkkg25iuTeGf5Bg.text: I gave an extra star simply because I couldn't try enough items on the menu to make a better recommendation.  Not eating pork, I am so limited with what I can eat at this restaurant. Hmmm...I'll try soup...nope-was told by the waitress that all of the soup broth is made with chicken and pork. Dan Dan noodles-those sound good. Nope, crumbled pork. Dumplings...must have dumplings. Nope...pork based soup and pork in every dumpling. So the next question to the waitstaff-what doesn't have pork. Well, the broccoli and steamed iceberg lettuce!! YUM!!! Who doesn't like steamed iceberg lettuce for dinner!?!?!  We were able to get the cold sesame noodles with chicken and the beef and rice. Sounds good. Well, not really. The chicken in the sesame noodles tasted very fatty and had little other flavor. The beef and rice dish was very sweet. We returned that dish to the kitchen and they were very nice about that. Bubble tea...love bubble tea. Well, no it is all milk tea. Can you not put milk in it? No. Why? The drinks are all powder drinks. Hmm, that's not tea to me. The crunchy tofu dish was very good, I must say!! But, a full dinner meal it does not make. I've been here several times forgetting my experience the time before. But, I think I got this. Not going back. I think the deal was sealed when we were leaving and noticed someone in the kitchen eating their meal over the same counter where food was being prepared.  I don't think they'll miss me. It is always crowded. Just not my thing.

FdHWedpGSDZeV-3dkVn1vg.text: Absolutely delicious. The pork buns were divine. It was really cool to see our noodles and dumplings being made while we were eating. A little on the expensive side for lunch but absolutely worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

J-4F508o_8gICPFVOeevEQ.text: Very delicious noodles :) Very recommended! I had the lamb noodle soup, which is consistently great. I also enjoy the tofu skin. A little crowded sometimes but that's expected.

tRHv7Gh7QcTRZb60V5faiQ.text: This is probably the worst noodles I've ever tried. In addition to that, their services were even worse than their food.

9_YZlHAzE3aztA7iEuNz5g.text: Consistently great food. Been going to Everyday Noodles since they 1st opened and I've never had a bad experience. Awesome homemade noodle dishes and the best soup dumplings and bubble tea. One of my top 5 restaurants in Pittsburgh for sure.

iliddGujzefbuT8B4eBaFQ.text: If I chose one Chinese restaurant in Pittsburgh to eat at, it would probably be Everyday Noodles!! The food is pretty authentic, with many menu options ranging from soup dumplings to wonton soup. My Braised Beef and Tendon Noodle Soup was a delicious choice, and very filling as well. Just that alone would make a fine meal for me! Otherwise, a common favorite is the soup dumplings. There are also a selection of drinks, and I tried the boba milk tea. It tasted legit but also didn't have a great flavor. So while it was okay, I don't think I would get the boba here again. Nonetheless, I enjoyed the food here a lot and would definitely come again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Braised Beef and Tendon Noodle Soup
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Milk Black Tea Tapioca Pearl Bubble Tea

m4RmAm1PIrEivCq-iKycVA.text: Words can not express how much I love this place! One of the few, if not the only place in Pittsburgh that has Soup Dumplings. A must have!  I was there on 11-14-16 and had soup dumplings and Hot Spicy Wonton Noodles. Unbelievable!  My wife had Sesame Cold Noodles with Chicken and loved it.  I'd love to go back just to enjoy their Dim Sum offerings.  Love the atmosphere with open kitchen and watching the Noodles made by hand. Just beware the loud bang from them preparing the Noodles.

8iXqgV9R4e-Fy4v1QWSRaA.text: First time visiting Pittsburgh, as a True Taiwanese I always want to explore Chinese cruises in the area. I was disappointed with the quality of food.   Milk tea with boba: milk tea is made from powder and the boba is not that chewy... It has this artificial taste of the tea..   Beef noodle soup: noodles are too soft and it didn't have the texture that I was looking for.. Broth is kinda light and doesn't have much beef flavor to it.. Beef is not tender and the beef does not retain the original beef taste..   Spicy wonton with noodle and veggie: the worst item... The wontons were not fully cooked..tasted some powder from the wontons...it is just not authentic Chinese food..  I would not recommend this if you are looking for authentic Chinese/ Taiwanese food..  Pork soup dumpling: the only acceptable items that I ordered... It is good but I didn't really amaze me.. If I have to come back again for any reason this is the only item I would want to order it again

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

zA0OHBEW1LvZm7tovyR2Qg.text: This is a solid place for dumplings in Pittsburgh, so-so for noodles. I've been here a few times over the course of the last year and my experience has always been consistent. I cannot speak to authenticity as I have never eaten soup dumplings outside of Everyday Noodles, but I enjoy them. Service has always been quick and attentive, refilling water, etc., before I have to ask.  Definitely get the pork soup dumplings. The Sunday shrimp and loofah ones are still good, but they don't quite match up to the pork version. My go-to order is pork soup dumplings, eggplant, and bok choy with oyster sauce. I have also tried and enjoyed the shumai, pork belly bun, beef shank, and wonton noodle soup. I've tried a few noodle soups and the Dan Dan noodles, but was not impressed and would not get them again.

tGpFlESWk0yr_Dgd5s6PnQ.text: Very consistent, authentic food. The pork soup dumplings are amazing. I always get the dumplings with the minced pork broccoli as a side. So good! Also the service is on-point. Fast, prompt, efficient!

GIHFUjt4nl4X0tLMZfA_Jg.text: There was a pretty long wait at lunch time for these noodles, but it was worth it. You can watch them making the noodles and dumplings right while you're waiting. They have a big selection of noodle soups, dumplings, and noodle dishes. We had the beef noodle soup which had a rich broth, a fair amount of beef and good portion of noodles. We also had the Dan Dan noodles which had a little spice to them (too much for my little guy, not enough for Mommy) and the Taiwanese rule sesame noodles. Both were very tasty! I also had the mango bubble tea which had real mango pieces, along with the tapioca, which was a nice surprise.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef noodle soup
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sesame noodles and Dan Dan noodles
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mango bubble tea

khr2Eir_EVia2PpJ9w1pNA.text: So this place became even better once we discovered that it is BYOB. The food was excellent; I had the pork, shrimp and vegetable wontons with braised beef over rice. The beef was tender, but I enjoyed the spicy wontons much more. My friend had the vegetable dumplings which he seemed to enjoy. We walked right in and were seated by the hostess. Everyone was really nice. We will definitely return here! Oh, and know that there is a $15 minimum to use a debit card. There's an ATM at the entrance if you want to use cash.

1SMRtm9K4GEvYZpirn1w5w.text: I expected a lot more from all the raving Yelp reviews but everything was just okay. There was no wait on a Wednesday night and my family and I were seated promptly. There are paper menus and pencils at each table for you to place your order.  The service was slow and inattentive. The server seemed reluctant to interact with us and it was honestly really off putting. We were seated for at least 10 minutes before she came and asked us if we'd like anything to drink. Since both tea and water are generally offered at Asian restaurants, I asked for tea, assuming it would be complimentary. However, if I hadn't looked at the menu myself, I wouldn't have known it cost $2.50 a cup. I feel like that's something that the server should have informed us of beforehand. When I tried to motion for a server to place the order, nobody really paid attention and they were socializing instead.   We ordered the braised beef noodle soup ($11), braised beef and tendon noodle soup ($11), and pork spare rib noodle soup consomme ($9), all with wide noodles. Our food came quickly once we ordered. I've been craving beef noodle soup since I had it in Taiwan but this was disappointing. The broth was too salty and the noodles were overcooked. Handpicked noodles are supposed to be chewy, but these were too soft and didn't have much "elasticity." I did appreciate how tender the meat was though. My grandpa praised how rich the broth in the pork spare rib noodle soup was.   This spot was average in terms of food and service and not worth the price (in NYC, you can get something even better for under $8).

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef noodle soup

lG4D6A55RHLfhVvO82UqcA.text: I came here expecting great, authentic Taiwanese noodles from recommendations from friends and Yelp reviews that raved about this place. Unfortunately, the noodle soups didn't quite live up to my standards.   Let's start with the good stuff: - Bubble teas taste great (I had jasmine green milk tea w/grass jelly) - Jellyfish appetizer was nicely pickled and fresh - Soup dumplings are pretty tasty too. Good thin dough, good flavor - Beef in scallion pancake was really savory. Thumbs up - Noodles itself had a good texture. Doughy, slightly chewy, just the way I like my hand-tossed noodles - Good, friendly service  Now the part for me that broke the deal was that the actual taste of the noodle dishes was completely bland.  - Ox tail soup - Soup was pretty much tasteless to me... - Zha Jiang mien - flavor was lacking in the sauce. Tasted to me like they just took a scoop of the Chinese bean sauce and mixed it in. (They did give a good portion of toppings and cucumbers, though)  They also refused to accommodate a take-out order for me where the noodles are packed separately and uncooked. This was 30 minutes before the restaurant closed so the kitchen should still be open ....  For a noodle restaurant, I expected more from the noodle staples. Sorry!  I would come back here for the milk teas and appetizers, though.

Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ox tail soup
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delicious jellyfish appetizer!

_Z-ag0eqJzMiyzWTBJ6peQ.text: Braised beef + tendon noodle soup - totally satisfied my craving for noodle soup this morning ! Was seated right away and food delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

CTPsqvexv3k1iT_4Tkuz2g.text: I love this place!! My sister recently moved close by and I always try to go here when I visit. We order a few items to share which include rice, potstickers, soup dumplings, and spicy wonton noodles. Let me tell you, when they say spicy they mean it! They are not for the faint of heart that's for sure. They also have shrimp dumplings in them which are delicious. I love getting to sit by the work windows where you can watch them make all the noodles. The service is fast and the atmosphere is relaxed. It's a small place inside but defiantly worth the wait!

KheCM7njOgAwFH2kAYH1Xw.text: Food here is legit. The service was friendly. Everything was great.   I ordered the braised beef over rice and it was fantastic. I wolfed it down in 5 minutes and I craved another bowl. Too bad my wallet was kinda light that day..  The xiao long bao was fantastic as well. Freshly made to order (right in front of the restaurant). Each bite was bursting with flavor! I recommend you eat it right away before it gets cold because it's best eaten right off the steamer.   The prices for this place isn't too expensive. Most (if not all) dishes are below $10. Would definitely come back again when I'm in the area

QyeZhza3ifbp5rIHr4cU_A.text: Very good food. You can tell they make their noodles fresh and you can watch them if you get there at the right time. I'm really only dinging this place because I was disappointed that they only have one vegetarian entree. I do highly recommend they veggie dumplings though!!

0DXKGog0Q5TZHkIEPXAOyQ.text: If you want authentic Chinese food without leaving Pittsburgh, this is the place for you.   My brother's family and I were here for dinner before heading back to Columbus, my brother is a noodle snob and he absolutely LOVED this place. We ordered way too much food, but yet, we finished all of them.   Highly recommend the Beef and Tendon noodles with the wide noodle, very tasty. I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef and tendon noodles
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef wrap
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

uXYKH2lcP36gZF7SXJnxFw.text: We waited about 25 minutes for a table and I wasn't hungry when we got there, but I was ready to eat once we got seated. You can watch them make the dumplings and the noodles. They'll also give out some of the dough to kids while they wait to entertain them.   I got the broccoli with oyster sauce and the vegetable dumplings, while my boyfriend got the crab and pork soup dumplings. About halfway through my dumplings, I looked at my boyfriend and said I didn't want the meal to end. Just writing this I am thinking about those dumplings and craving them again. The dough was the perfect consistency and the vegetables had such a great flavor.   I HIGHLY recommend this place if you're in Pittsburgh.

NWM5bc8C3U1QQtVegSQ2jQ.text: Excellent noodles and extremely clean kitchen. You can watch them make the noodles as you dine, so enjoy the show!   I was super sick with a cold, sour throat and ear ache, and asked the hubby to get take out for some noodle soup. I ordered the shrimp and pork wonton soup with the wide noodles. About an hour after I was done with my soup, my earache and sore throat was gone! Seriously gone! Still stuffy with the cold, but this was a miracle soup that saved my day!   These noodles are freshly made and are delicious. With so many options available in the area, Everyday Noodles is a sure standout among them.

GVN6U3feFrlX3d2DUZWW1w.text: Oh the high reviews for Everyday Noodles.. I was super excited for some authentic Taiwanese food and some handmade noodles! I can see the hype around this place but after trying so many dishes, we really didn't get what the hype was about. We had to wait about 10 mins or so.. which wasn't bad for a Friday around lunchtime. The lady was super apologetic we had to wait and came by to apologize and tell us there were tables still paying/chatting - we appreciated it but we understood and it definitely wasn't their fault! She was so super nice! I enjoyed watching the guys make dumplings and noodles from the window while we sat and waited.  We finally got a table and they took a few mins to grab our order. You get a piece of paper and mark the items based on how many of each dish you want. Super quick, super efficient! I can see how it could be difficult though if you weren't familiar with the dishes cause there were no pictures.    *Xiao Long Bao aka Soup Dumplings - This was one of the dishes I was underwhelmed with. The skin was thick, the dumplings didn't contain very much soup, and the meat flavors were just ok - a bit salty and heavy on the ginger. The sauce was also vinegar or dumpling sauce - usually they give you sliced ginger and you pour vinegar or a sauce over it. 3/5  *Braised Beef and Tendon Noodle Soup - I did like the fresh noodles and the braised beef in this dish. The beef and tendon was tender and the flavors of the broth were spot on. 4/5  *Braised Minced Pork over Rice - This dish was as expected. Flavors were good. Rice and meat ratio was a bit off - too much rice, not enough meat. Enjoyed the egg as well! 4/5  *Hot Spicy Wonton Noodles - Pretty Spicy. Noodles dried up and clumped together if you don't mix it quickly enough. Wontons were ok. 3/5  *Dan Dan Noodles - Not like the traditional Szechuan Dan Dan Noodles. It tasted like a peanut sauce mixed with noodles. 2/5  My problem with all the noodles is that they were the same in every dish. Nothing different but the sauce or broth. To be fair they do give you an option for thick or thin noodles and we should've ordered a mix, but I don't think it would change how I felt about the dishes.   *Baby Bok Choy with Oyster Sauce - as expected but just a bit on the salty side. 3/5  *Crispy Pork Buns - not crispy enough. Meat was good. 3/5  *Green Onion Pancake - I liked the flavors but it was a bit doughy and so needed to be crispier. 4/5  *Sweet Egg Bun - my favorite out of all the dishes we ordered. I loved the salty/sweet egg custard with a soft pillowy bun. 5/5  Overall, just ok.. I wasn't amazed but I would come back for a few certain dishes, especially when it's cold out!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hot Spicy Wonton Noodles Mixed Up
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Left Crispy Pork Buns and Right Crispy Green Onion Pancake
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Baby Bok Choy with Veggie Oyster Sauce

qYoMW9xnt6-sP7t0Wc7WVA.text: Everyday Noodles good but I wouldn't say it's a "must visit." If you're craving noodles or dumplings, it's a great place.   The pork soup dumplings were a little disappointing. The soup was a little gamey from the pork and just didn't have that umami soup flavor. That said, the skin was really delicious and it's amazing to watch them make the dumplings and kind of mesmerizing to see an entire, beautiful tray of dumplings. You can ask for ginger and spicy oil which cuts out some of the gaminess.   We also had the dan dan noodles. The noodles were quite good, they had that perfect chewy flavor. It was a little too creamy and peanut-y but overall good.   The other food looked great, especially the scallion pancake beef roll.   They also have a 5% cash discount. The restaurant was very busy around 1 pm on a Saturday but the line moved quite quickly and they were pretty empty by 2 pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dan Dan Noodles Szechuan Style
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork Soup Dumplings (8)

_Ry5mdGs-jNxQVXf8K0X_A.text: This place is A1. A group of us came after church with Chinese-American friends. They helped us choose from the extensive menu, including soup dumplings, of course. Didn't have a bad dish the whole meal. Watch out: the soup bowls are very large. Try to save room for the red bean sesame dessert--served warm! Very busy at lunch time on weekends, so get there early, or you'll have to stand in line.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Soup dumplings
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Friends!

3UtZv26jI98yC32XJRBMkA.text: A great spot for fresh, hand-pulled noodles! It can be a little loud when they bang the counter with the dough during the pulling process, but it's really interesting to watch.  Apart from any of the dishes with noodles in them, my favorite thing to order are the soup dumplings and some bubble tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

q6yJapP7Xw3C4QX2OYLrGA.text: Soup dumplings, pot stickers, scallion pancakes.... SO GOOD! Friendly service and consistency makes it a go-to for us monthly and we never regret it.

gw-HA1ELFqJumeamoSqUGA.text: Absolutely amazing place. One of the best pork soup dumplings in the world. I routinely go here for pork soup dumplings and hot spicy noodles. Green pancakes are also one of my favorite.

GZFKel8IXIu0F8REgaM5cA.text: Food brings me back to sweet memories of home cook meal that my parents make. Servicer is quick and efficient.

8Q38WNktUSh8Fny-Hd4Big.text: Was in town and tried it out. It was decent, food was fresh and noodles very tender. I got the dan dan thick noodles and it was decent. The XLB we tried was good, but not really hot enough. I tried some beef soup noodles too. We ordered two sides, the jellyfish salad and the wood ears and was underwhelming. The food is reasonably priced however I don't think I'd come back for it.

l64BhvwJ-3hpMijhi-UInw.text: Came here tonight for my mom in law's birthday! This was my first time. We were seated right away. I immediately thought this place was so cool because you can watch the experts make dumplings and noodles through big windows. We ordered a variety of different things to try. To start, we ordered the beef tendon, broccoli, veggie dumplings, and pork soup dumplings. Everything came out super hot (and quickly!). At first bite, you could tell everything was made fresh. I also ordered the pork shrimp wonton noodle soup, with wide noodles. Again, it was definitely so fresh. They have a lot of unique items on their menu. I can't wait to come back and try something new!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegetable Dumplings (8)
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork Soup Dumplings (8)
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Marinated Beef Tendon

Rwuew2BNO_Y-LJxbGU37HA.text: Stopped by for a late dinner on Friday - the place was packed but we only had to wait about 20 minutes for a table for two. The restaurant is tight and tables are packed pretty close together, but the decor is great and the atmosphere is lively, hip, and a little edgy.   Bubble teas are delicious, but definitely sweet and rich enough to serve as dessert, not a beverage. The boba is very sugary and the tea is mixed with pretty heavy milk/cream. Probably the most intensely sweet bubble tea I've ever had. They don't seem to serve hot boba here, either.   I was a little disappointed in the lack of vegetarian options. There are maybe three or four things on the entire menu labeled as vegetarian? Though there are many Noodle soups without meat, they are all served in a chicken/meat broth. Since the only vegetarian noodles were cold sesame, and I really came for some noodle soup, I ended up ordering a dish with fat noodles, mushroom and bamboo and just not drinking the chicken broth. Not ideal, but worth it for the amazing chewy noodles. All the flavors were great, but these noodles obviously make the restaurant a hit.   The portions were huge and we couldn't finish everything. Prices were very affordable, less than $30 for noodles and bubble tea for two people. Though there may be a wait, the food is served at lightening speed - I think we got our noodles in less than ten minutes.   I had a lot of fun eating here and will definitely be back. Looking forward to trying the veggie dumplings.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dan Dan Noodles Szechuan Style

c5eqZgVQqToCeLrDU2Qfpg.text: Had a late lunch here and I was impressed! The food was very good! They had it decorated nicely and the food staff were polite and explained food items on the menu well. The jasmine green tea was also very good! I would definitely go here again! This restaurant was also well priced!

xb6_3-L9wPdPNma0vtzUQA.text: Met friends here for lunch after reading numerous reviews about the place and it didn't disappoint! Partially chose this place due to the free entertainment of watching the kitchen staff make the noodles- always a bonus when dining with small children.  Arrived a little after 1pm on a weekday and was seated promptly- cute ambiance and friendly service. You check off what you want from the menu and the server reviews it with you prior to submitting ticket to kitchen. We decided (group of 3 adults and 2 kids) to share family style and went with:  Pickled cucumber (really good w a hint of spice!) Pork soup dumplings (delicious) Shrimp,pork,wonton noodle soup (very good - but would ask for a side of spice to make more interesting) Braised beef and tendon noodle soup  Taiwanese pork belly sliders (amazing) Pan fried pork bun (only item we didn't finish) Sweet egg yolk steam buns (wow) As well as taro and Thai iced tea bubble teas  Everything was overall really great- you get a choice of thick or thin noodles in the noodle soups   Only thing missing from the experience was a toddler friendly kids menu (a simple fried chicken item would have been perfect or a basic noodle in a small portion size )  Highly recommended overall!

hFzmWObglYMbZeCxF91xkA.text: I love the food here! Don't be intimidated by the large crowd of people in the doorway - they seat people quickly and the wait time is usually less than estimated  The one downside of the menu is that they only have a few vegetarian options. Nevertheless, the ones they do have are delicious. I usually go with the bamboo and mushroom noodle soup (it's not marked vegetarian so it probably has a meat-based broth or something, but shhhh don't tell me). The vegetarian dumplings are incredible! Be warned, their portions are bigger than the prices suggest  It's hard to beat soft chewy fresh-made noodles, so fresh you can watch them being made!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wonton noodle soup
