Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cold sesame noodles

_CVTgmW1srRdlPoWm1QgGw.text: We loved this place! We ordered a lot of different dishes to try. Braised beef noodle soup was SO GOOD! The beef was very tender, and the soup was so flavorful. The other dish I liked a lot was coconut sweet red bean cakes. It is with right amount of sweetness and I enjoyed the texture. I really liked the taro milk tea. The flavor was strong, and they only offer in cold. Great to have it along with some noodles. The price is very reasonable as well. I will definitely come back when I visit Pittsburgh next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Milk Black Tea Flavor, Milk Taro Tea Flavor
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Braised Beef Noodle Soup, Rolled Onion Pancakes w. Sliced Beef
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Coconut Sweet Red Bean Cakes (3)

SRSS_eMlQI8BLPQQYq68jQ.text: We came to Everyday Noodle on our last day in Pittsburgh. It was the day after a wedding, right before hitting the road and leaving town to head home. The restaurant came highly recommended by a friend who lives in the area. Our seats were right in front of the kitchen, so we had a view of chefs making fresh noodles and dumplings.  Coming from Washington, DC, we were very excited by the prices and ordered entirely too much food. Dishes included soup dumplings, steamed dumplings, two noodle dishes, scallion pancakes, and more. Everything was great. My only complaint is some of the dishes that were marked as spicy did not have as much flavor as I would have liked. The amount of red pepper flakes added really just took away from some of the other flavors I wanted to be there.  Overall, the restaurant had some great food that was served up very quickly, for a great price.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

I8sXkwzt6IunhRPIA80Bmw.text: Check this place out to tray soup dumplings. They are little dumplings filled with a soup from the meat inside the dumpling. I recommend trying their noodle dishes especially the dan dan noodles. In addition the pancakes are delicious added with sliced meat. When you come, you will see the workers hand-pulling noodles. These noodles are more chewy and super fresh. They may not be the same size because they are handmade. The service is really great and they are very helpful in recommending what to try.   This is a great place to check out with a group of friends. I will be back!

JtTbPWclsdvXBPSsFGi_1Q.text: I had really high hopes and expectations for this place. Was really excited to find a place that made hand pulled noodles. Boyfriend and I wanted to try a bunch of things and ended up ordering the  jellyfish salad, pork belly sliders, wonton soup, dan dan noodles, and oxtail noodle soup consume.   - Jellyfish Salad: Nice refreshing dish but it needed a more vinegary taste. Never had my jellyfish salad served under a small bed of lettuce --don't know how I feel about that.  - Pork Belly Sliders: Tasty but overall over priced.   - Wonton Soup: Pretty standard. Weird to see that they put a couple pieces of broccoli in the soup.   - Dan Dan Noodle: Felt like the noodles should have had a thicker texture to help the dish. Flavors were average.  - Oxtail Noodle Soup: I got it with the flour noodles. Nice clear and light broth. Good amounts of oxtail included in the dish which was a plus. Oxtail was fall off the bone tender. Probably one of the better dishes we got.  Overall nothing really stood out in flavor or presentation. Sadly everything just felt lackluster. For a place that makes fresh hand pulled noodles, it was missing the homemade texture. Hard to put my finger on it but the dishes just felt like they were missing something.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Jellyfish salad

Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oxtail noodle soup

jjzjhslps87GMSzJkoHDGw.text: If you haven't been to everyday noodle then you are crazy! The food here is incredible, a top contender of places to go if you are a fan of good asian cuisine. Compared to their competitors around them, they offer more to their menu other places don't typically offer with the great quality.   Along with the great food the service is typically on point, food comes out just as fast as you order it even on day's they're packed!  The only thing I can say is make sure you get in early or else you'll have to wait in their long lines just trying to get a seat, but it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

kSEeX3eF6lfUdG_6vPsSpA.text: As stated, the soup dumplings are amazing. However, everything else we've tried is very good, too. Quick service, reasonable prices, good balance of flavors- just great all around!

XyLMfJys1oMPIfMSgQBZYw.text: Authentic Taiwanese chefs making soup dumplings and noodles- there is nothing like this in Pittsburgh my friends! Every time we go, we get stacks of pork soup dumplings with a pork slider and noodle soup on the side. Servers are nice. The owner is hilarious.

jvaCxqHQu04nO45w8Lzx2w.text: Great lunch or takeout spot - a wide variety on the menu, the bamboo shoots and mushroom appetizer was delicious, as well as the soup dumplings and scallion pancake. Very reasonably priced and good service.

O1lxSxFQr-Qx2rAwz1iTQQ.text: nice turkish food,me and my husband love it! the only thing is bread is so so. anyway this time found right place!

bKkuP4ziK6cFaUYvnTYYWA.text: I like their soup dumplings, but their noodle soup is so so. The noodles are ok but the broth doesn't have much depth and their braised beef isn't very flavorful.  Their chili oil is little too cooked for my taste.  I will still go here for dumplings but not for noodle soups.

c07QKlF6GrOfctVqE6Wy2Q.text: I had the sesame noodles with chicken it was good, but it had a peanut flavor in it which I didn't care for.  They make all the noodles on site so there really fresh.

GfoRIT1TVDeonq9Vpb9sww.text: This is another fine addition to the Asian food scene in Pittsburgh (which I feel is lacking in quality/authentic places).  A fun (and reasonably priced) place to try multiple smaller dishes with several friends.  We went on a cold winter day and got their braised beef and tendon soup, mushroom and bamboo soup, pork and vegetable potstickers, vegetable dumplings, and their braised beef and drunken chicken appetizers.  I was unaware that the braised beef and drunken chicken appetizers were served chilled, otherwise I would not have ordered them on such a cold day in the winter - but they were reasonably tasty.  Our favorites of everything were the pork potstickers, which were very flavorful - but eat them when they are hot - the flavor is definitely not as good as they cool down.  Interestingly, mushroom and bamboo soup had a very flavorful broth - deeper flavored than the braised beef.  The bamboo was a purplish color that tasted like it was marinated or pickled in something - very tasty.  Also, the glass container on the table that looks like soy sauce is actually soy sauce mixed with vinegar, and a little sugar, I believe.  Most likely made more as a dipping sauce for the dumplings and potstickers.  That was tasty.  This place is BYOB with a $5 corkage fee.

Txt7yLh09VsfJb7z6M2mYQ.text: This was our third time here on a snowy Sunday in May ( perfect weather for noodles). Busy for such a dreadful day.  My daughter always gets the chicken soup.  Perfect!  They always leave our the scallions and shred the chicken (instead of leaving it on the bone). Great service. I had the Spicy Wonton noodles ( yummy...I eat the wontons then have lunch the next day with noodles). Husband has the minced pork noodles ( also very good).  No soup dumplings this time as we only have so much room ). We did try the Fried Tofu appetizer. Not to my liking....I didn't like the pudding texture of the inside.....thought it would be firmer. Daughter wouldn't even try as its a texture that she can't eat ( no jello or pudding for her either). Crispy sweet buns are the perfect ending...like the best warm doughnut ever!

hH9MtlIf8lh2n1GRRhP2Pw.text: Came here on vacation with family, this place has lovely seating, very unique. You can watch the chefs making your noodles! I haven't had beef brisket noodle since I was a kid and it's one of my favorite meals, was lucky they serve them here. We also had the bubble tea with pudding crab and regular dumplings and some pancakes rolls. Hand made noodles taste the best~ Will come back again for more gourmet soon~

NfJYJYYhRsDYLx8ExVRQ_A.text: I had heard good things about this place and found that almost none of them are True. I ordered the top three most popular things on the menu: pork soup dumplings, pork belly bun, braised beef noodles. The pork soup dumplings were okay. The pork belly buns were AWFUL, like tasted like a mish-mash of gross shite. And the beef was ok, but the noodles tasted overwhelmingly like dough; totally overpowered the broth and tasted like I was eating raw spaghetti.  Bleh...

Z8L3c0gTCe7gm8n44Ei8Zw.text: Very good place for dinner. It looks and feels modern. The dumplings were well balanced in taste and texture. For example, the veggie dumplings have some nice nut crunchiness. The noodle soup I tried was above average (beef and tendon) and I really liked the chili oil they served it with. Need to come back!  For vegetarians: they have an off-the-menu soup with mushrooms and zucchini and other veggie goodies (my companion loved it).

zPaEPNjksBcGbDHV-9Hfeg.text: The soup dumplings are unbelievable!  Today we tried the soup dumplings, the shrimp and pork wonton soup, the tofu skins with wood ear mushrooms, and the noodles with minced pork sauce.  The portions are huge, the service is great, and the food is quite good.  The noodles with minced pork sauce is tasty and not over sauced.  I was very, very impressed and will definitely be back.

UooQE4j43LyvL77JIEGLDg.text: Love that there is now an authentic noodle house in pittsburgh- definitely reminiscent of the joints I found in Hong Kong. The noodles are made freshly in front of you - and you can taste it! I enjoy the beef soup and the pork noodles - the meat quality is not the best I've ever had, but it is always tasty and acceptable for the price. Some of the preparations haven't been my favorite - the Dan Dan noodles were a little too peanuty for my liking- but definitely have had good experiences overall and go back frequently.

9N6t1Ox7rInYOLshBhO-aw.text: Excellent food. Excellent service. Nice environment.  Could use a few ore vegetarian noodle options

r88GXDEPMqmPE9hUNZr9Jg.text: This place is a really sweet addition to Pittsburgh's dining options. I thought everything was a cool experience for me because I have honestly never seen anything like this.   Since I'm not very familiar with Chinese food like this I had a ton of questions on exactly what I was ordering. The waitstaff were very helpful and introduced us to some great eats. We ordered Wood Ears & Sliced Tofu kin appetizer which was very tasty and an ample size for two, keep this in mind when ordering that the noodles and dumplings are very large portion sizes so don't order too many appetizers or you will have to bring home food, we did.  As our main dish we tried the Braised Beef Noodle soup and Dan Dan noodles. The Braised Beef Noodles are in a huge bowl of broth with a ton of noodles. I loved the tenderness and subtle flavoring of the beef that was in the soup. The Dan Dan noodles are "Dry Noodles," but don't let that be misleading you still get a hefty bowl of noodles that are coated in a sauce similar to a peanut sauce with a little bit of kick.   I'm a big fan of Bubble Tea, and fortunately it is offered here and have to say that your options to customize your Tea to what you like are available. I have actually never had been offered so many options for my bubble tea.  On another note I wasn't sure if they offer forks for us lazy folks, but I suggest taking your time through your meal and sticking to using the chopsticks. I have never  used chopsticks for noodles and it was certainly an experience but fun and made our lunch stretch out a little longer than normal. But if you want a fork I saw some folks using forks on our way out.  Another cool thing is the dudes cranking out in- house noodles and dumplings,it sort of reminds me of making taffy. You should Check it out!

WgN58R7tinayZj2x9qepvg.text: Being spoiled by eating dumplings in LA, I was initially hesitant towards a pittsburgh dumpling house. Annnnd that was a stupid human hipster biased thought. Being nudged by a friends recommendation....this place was without a doubt great, you could see the staff making the dumplings, and they were served proper with a smile. The bamboo steam pots were a nice touch as well.

XnLovNoESqIgG1wCKrXcAw.text: First, I am SO glad to see a hand made noodle shop in PGH!!! This city needs more authentic Asian restaurants so I hope this is the tip of the spear. With that said, I was disappointed that there was not a large vegetarian menu. I understand that the broths need to be made as they are; however, how hard is it to have a veggie broth hanging in the wings or a quick miso? Regardless, there are a few items that non meat lovers can enjoy and the experience is worth it. Plus, if this town is going to get more restaurants preparing food aside from General Tso's than we all need to support!

QJUjcVS9gmKtnrgiogkRUA.text: The noodle soups here are quite bleh. I ordered the chicken noodle, hoping for delicious chunks of chicken and ramen or maybe udon-style noodles. What I got was an unappetizing bowl of flat, flavorless noodles with three boiled chicken drumettes and three pieces of bok choy floating around. Maybe their non-soup dishes are better, but I would go to Ramen Bar across the street instead if you want a noodle soup.

qcaa263kc97FO9WJEmfaUQ.text: I hate how they make you sit at a table with strangers. So awkward. The veggie dumplings were yummy though. Everything else was just okay.

5pMfrpGPijWgosOMrzjL9g.text: The noodles were awesome- I chose rice noodles, because of an allergy and they were delicious. The portions were HUGE, so I took my leftovers home. When I heated them up the consistency was a little mushy and not very appealing. When I Go again I will definitely share a portion with someone, because it is better fresh. The place was really cute and our server Jessie was great!!!! Big fan!

hFOkwmPcBbwzqSxfiee6Nw.text: Everyday Noodles was a breath of fresh air for me, coming from a city with very very few authentic AND delicious Chinese restaurants. Except for one entre (the minced pork with noodles, word is that it tasted like liver), we were all very happy with our meals. The potstickers were fantastic, and come out all bunched together - they had been taken straight out of the pan. I had the won ton noodles, which were actually spicy! So happy. I tried the cold sesame noodles with chicken that my friend ordered, and I was almost jealous - peanut/lime/noodle/chicken combo was delicious.   Best of all, they make the noodles in front of you! They actually ran out of noodles at one point, so they had two noodle-makers thumping huge ropes of pasta dough on a counter in front of us. Dinner and entertainment, excellent.

C3zXus7Lvp06YdEuZtAOjA.text: We had dumplings, potstickers, beef braised noodle soup and wonton soup. All of it was great. They forgot my bubble tea, but service was good.

XH-n4AuzWwFAlXhnTqpbzQ.text: Excellent food. Soup dumplings, noodle dishes are awesome and to my taste on par with similar restaurants in places like NYC Chinatown. Fast and efficient too. Can't wait to come back

Qer4EMy5gesUWrWP1frfaA.text: Love this place! Fresh noodles, good service. Try one of the steamed veggies with oyster sauce - delicious!

3T--R_ptnkjhQL7COw0keQ.text: Out of site food! I could seriously eat myself silly on there soup dumplings! I would eat there every week if I were closer! Love it!

RO7IhRhc6p6L2Rg99w70xQ.text: Excellent.....My only complaint is that it's not the most comfortable spot for a slow paced, relaxing meal.   The food comes out in rapid order.

MxellLOQ0Cl6V0i257gQMQ.text: I'm in a food coma but I liked the food so much that I'm going to take the effort to rate this place 5 stars. Much Amazing food. Soup dumplings are the BEST.

biYot6h-OXc15ReUOFNdaw.text: I really like the pork soup dumplings at Everyday Noodles and it's fun to sit and watch the chefs making noodles. It can get a bit noisy, but it's a fun atmosphere.

_DmsiOibg0qgJtpMeWXi9w.text: I love this place. I'm a chinese-american, and it feels so authentic and homey whenever I go. I've gotten multiple noodle dishes, and they're all great. Of course, the soup dumplings are a must! I think you could order anything from this menu and it'd be top quality.

EOIl0xSb5jBC0mHEmi97Bg.text: I am surprised I liked this place as much as I did. I ordered  vegetable dumplings. the guy next to me suggested I use the large spoon, add a splash of vinegar and a splash of soy sauce and top it with some ginger. I did that and wow I am glad I listened. I don't know much about dumplings really so that is how I end my review. i will go back and try something else real soon.

8A9u4v1HZB5yt9mgTKoPSg.text: Everyday Noodles: Noodles with a "Show" So, confession time... yes, it's True...I have been to Benihana. You know, one of those ridiculous hibachi establishments where you pay a fortune to witness the "showmanship" of some guy throwing a few shrimps at your mouth. Do yourself a favor; don't go, even if they did send you a "Free Entree for your Birthday" coupon. Instead, head over to Everyday Noodles in Squirrel Hill. Here, you can be entertained and eat Taiwanese-style noodles gimmick-free. When you enter Everyday Noodles, the first thing you notice, besides the aroma of delicious eats, is the row of cooks/chefs stationed behind a large pane of glass. While being escorted to your table, you're very likely to witness (and be totally mesmerized) with a gentleman who is wielding an enormous stretch of dough. He'll continuously stretch and pull the dough, making you jump as he slaps it down to the counter from time to time. These cooks are masters at what they do. Considering the owner, Mike Chen, personally selects cooks from Taipei to visit Pittsburgh to train his employees, it's no shock to see such expertise. To read my full review, including photos, please visit: fork2mouth.blogspot.com/...

U-QTMQDkU9xuvAHwvLgfOw.text: I was excited to try this place out, but it was okay.... Food was not memorable and it's a little overpriced.  Beware of what you order, because it sure adds up!  For a group of 3, we nearly paid $60.  However, i wouldnt mind paying $60 if the food was actually good and flavorful.  The soup and dumplings were tasteless.  It simply doesn`t have that "Oomph" factor.  Please improve and i will consider coming back!!  Or at least release a groupon or livingsocial deal, so more people can afford eating here!!

rzYkfRMg-VIt6zpjrSTVyg.text: I would give it a 6 if they let me. I have been waiting for them to open and they finally did. My husband and I went in the other day. The place was packed. I don't know how  people decided on price but you pay about $10 to $11 for a noodle soup which I guess it is kind of standard here in Pittsburgh. I had Won ton noodle. It took a little longer. The wonton noodle was an average but their beef soup noodle was a A+ and it is also faster. We will be back to try their steam dumpling. The Roman bar across the street has definitely been impacted by this Everyday noodle's grand opening.

dgil9HFsrZI3FPtLSUYJ3Q.text: super comforting food, from tasty appetizer plates to share or a big bowl of hot noodle soup all for your own. i've been to everyday noodles a few times, and have throughly enjoyed my experiences.  five spiced eggplant- steamed eggplant doused in a yummy sweet & nutty sauce. yum. shiitake mushroom & bamboo shoots- such a good side plate to have with your bowl of soup! i think it's a little salty on its own, but add it to your bites of soup for a great combination. pork soup dumplings- if you've never had soup dumplings, you must! tiny bundles of juicy goodness. noodle soups- yum yum yum. great broths, handmade noodles. what else do you need?

hnqBHeQfRrkUb1zfCuJpMA.text: Amazing hand-made noodles. Noodles are made right in front of you.  Soup dumplings are special. A must for those visiting Sq. Hill.

TKwiutIkz0Azhetrbe6Fzw.text: This place is always busy. Food is ok. The soup dumplings are worth the trip. If you go at lunchtime they might take until the end of your meal to arrive.

YKSx3-iXbnN_8puWatFyCQ.text: My favorite are lamb noodle and bubble tea.Their noodle are tasty and excellent even for a Chinese people.I often go there for noodles.

dQYnGihTzX7T5zMrhqgeew.text: I went to the Everyday noodle last night with my boyfriend and my other friends. The restaurant was packed and we had to line up for tables. We thought the food should be good since it is a new place, and I have already heard a lot of people talking about it before I decided to go and try.   Most of the people kind of go there to have the soup dumplings, which made us looking forward a lot to have that. There was a big window at the entrance, in which the chefs were showing how to make noodles. It looks fun and interesting, and which makes the place very "sexy".   We ordered jellyfish and beef tender. The half of the dish of the jellyfish was cabbage. I could say the jellyfish I make at home is way much better than that. Then, we tried the soup dumplings. Actually, there is no soup in the dumpling, and the meat in the dumpling is too smashed. I was very disappointed. The taste was only so so.   My friend ordered a Wonton Men. It tasted like only wontons,noodles and oil. The Wonton Men tasted very BLAND, and my friend could not even continue to eat that after her first bite. My boyfriend ordered beef tender noodle, which has the broth came out with it. The broth was okay, but the noodles tasted not like the noodle made by hand. It tasted like INSTANT NOODLE instead.   The service was good though. The owner of the restaurant was very nice. He brought the food out to us and explained everything. The decoration is cool, but the tables and seats are all fixed and settled on the floor. They could not be moved, so it' was very hard for us to sit in.

-QXX-7KxLnWL6KPjPKpXtQ.text: It was great that they delivered late but I wasn't too impressed with any of the food or blown away.

sbCdn3I4NJdR7x3z19aseg.text: "Whap!!"    This is the sound you"ll hear over and over again as huge ropes of dough are swung and slammed in the kitchen. The show is amazing, but even better: this dough is being turned into some of the best noodles in town. They don't come any fresher.  Everyday Noodles only opened a few days ago, but already lines are out the door.  The wait wasn't bad; There are noodles to watch, bubble teas to drink, and a pleasant staff to banter with. It's the sort of menu where you check off your order with a pencil.  Even so, things came out not quite as ordered (shrimp dumplings instead of pork, meat sauce instead of oyster).  But you know what?  It was all delicious so we didn't care.  The five-spice eggplant was particularly good.  We took the micro-managing of our dumplings, by various servers, with a grain of salt. Pittsburgh has been long overdue for a place like this.  Don't miss it.

ibx30ltbAgoBnq_OKHfWTQ.text: I can't quite elaborate on how truly amazing this restaurant is.  Follow my lead and get the fried green onion pancakes.    Hands down, one of the best Asian restaurants in Pittsburgh.

dzpTz1L71PBUAJqvQvFkPQ.text: I spent the whole week in Pittsburgh thinking there's no good ethnic food. Then I discovered Squirrel Hills.... This restaurant has a very modern vibe. The food however is fairly authentic (hand made noodles, soup dumplings, and other snack type of Chinese food). The food is Taiwanese in style although some dishes have a northern China vibe.  - beef noodle soup: good stewed beef, good noodle, soup could've been brothier (just add some juice from the beef stew), I'm also missing pickled veggies Taiwanese style; - soup dumplings: tried the Sunday special seafood ones, very light and delicate tasting, waitress gave us dishes with ginger but no vinegar which is a little odd; - Dan Dan noodle: soupier that what I'm used to, not spicy either, was alright.  Overall a pretty great spot, sorry for being picky, I'm just really Chinese lol.

FBL3k9tz-wK-Kl9wDsKxQw.text: I sadly thought my meal was awful here.   I ordered the steamed shrimp dumplings and was sorely disappointed, the shrimp tasted like cheap frozen shrimp farmed in ponds dumped with antibiotics and then treated with bleach after.  I also tried some noodle soup and I wanted to like them but the texture and flavor was off-putting to me.  I expected a lot, $10 for eight tiny dumplings that "tasted" like i could have gotten them frozen in an asian grocery store somewhere wasn't what I expected.  I have only tried two dishes, take this review with a grain of salt, but I am scared to go back and try anything else because i fear it will be a waste of my money on top of experiencing even more disappointment.

5RqExRkEogzxm3X0tSRosg.text: There was a lot of hype about this place, and sadly I wasn't very impressed.  Part of the experience is looking through the window that lets customers see the food being made, which is cool. But I don't think I really like ramen noodles; they were chewy--which I'm not a fan-- and it didn't have much flavor. Everything else in my (kind of small ~$10) noodle soup bowl was good - bean sprouts, chives, pork, and egg.  We also ordered the pork soup dumplings, which were new to me. I'm glad I put the whole dumpling in my mouth rather than biting it! The burst of soup was a nice and tasty surprise.   Another upside was the taro milk tea which was pretty good for Pittsburgh; it was creamy in the best way. One thing was that I didn't ask for bubbles/boba, I said it was milk tea, not boba--it just came with the drink.  If anything I'd come back for the soup dumplings, not so much the noodle bowls.

vsNzUHq6gGRqeKC-9IznFw.text: Growing up in Pittsburgh, I was really excited for a noodle place.  The food however is over priced for what it is and not very tasty.  I got one thing of xiao long baos (soup dumplings) and it was $10?  I mean.. lets be real here...  I didn't think it was that flavorful. But I guess for Pittsburgh it's ok.   I also got the scallion pancake and beef thingy..  Not good either. I would rather spend my $20 somewhere else...   The atmosphere is weird.. it's a small place, but you can sit at the "bar" and watch the chef's make the dough/noodles...  They slam the dough really hard onto the counter top so if you're sitting at the bar, just be warned that you'll jump every 10 seconds.

XZifO-QoR_9Ygaj7FfdNJA.text: Really good food and they deliver. The last time we ordered the braised pork rice bowl, pork soup dumplings, and chicken noodle based dish. All were fantastic. The food was delivered within a half hour of placing the order which is amazing. Have been here multiple times and it's food quality is very consistent.

P5x8yQKQiEo9fj_hIpqPiA.text: It WAS one of my favorite restaurants but they really disappointed me; I will never go back. The beef of the noodle soup was hard as a rock! I complained about it and they brought me the same dish with the same inedible beef. Not even my dog would have eaten it.

oirNzRayUVgIwqBJkxg5Aw.text: heard about this from a few colleagues and tried it out. we ordered soup dumplings, cold sesame noodles, hot spicy wonton noodles, potstickers, 5 spice eggplant. Def not small portions so I would recommend only ordering a couple of smaller dishes or 1 entree. Our waitress taught us how to eat certain dishes and was super helpful since we def were out of place. Would highly recommend this to others!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. pork and vegetable potstickers (fried a little extra)
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. cold sesame noodles
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hot spicy wonton noodles

JwLs-TwPkxn5DAYZ6OyhmQ.text: A friend and I shared the braised beef noodle soup, oxtail noodle soup, and vegetable dumplings. The broth and noodles are excellent, the meat, however is another story. The oxtail was not as tender or as juicy as I expected. The braised beef was flavorful but could have been more tender.  Overall, the noodles and broth are among the best I have ever had. This place gets only 3 stars because the meat could be better and the dishes are only moderately priced.  Friendly and quick service. Very busy even on an early Thursday evening.

YGjni1yfvevGhYt4JNqOnQ.text: We ordered the beef tendons, some green stir w minced pork, the famous pork soup dumplings, shrimp and veg potsticks, wonton noodle soup and braised shredded pork over rice. The food is generally OK. I'm very impressed w the beef tendons which are really nicely braised and has a jelly-ish texture. The potsticks are good too especially w the ginger vinegar. But the soup dumplings are a little disappointing. I have anticipating having their dumplings due to what ppl say on Yelp. But they are no better than just mediocre Chinese soup dumplings. Despite juicy and flavorful, the soup inside is  too salty and greasy to be appropriate. And that's the reason why they don't taste good when they are cold. The wonton noodle soup is a mixture of PERFECT noodles, mediocre wontons and salty soup that tastes terribly like chicken powder. The shredded pork over rice is OK but also very salty. Anyway, I highly recommend the nicely stretched noodles here and the potsticks.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef tendons are the best!!
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steamed pork soup dumplings. I love juicy soup inside.
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp and vegetable potsticks. Yum.

a2BRxA-cOyehGBKeYAhCMA.text: Took a friend out for her birthday dinner tonight and WOW, this place is awesome. Great food - everything we ordered came out really fast and was super delicious.   My critique: Soup dumplings were delicious, but each one was on the small side (made me glad that one order gives you 8 of them). Pork slider was literally one big slider and a little difficult to cut up and split. Dan Dan noodles were wonderfully savory with a hint of spicy. Crispy mini milk buns were perfection.   I wish I could eat here everyday - pun intended. I will definitely be heading back because this place is a gem!!

w2q-xK71CyVCw0MCcPdmbg.text: I took someone out here based off good reviews and was a nightmare. The food was horrible. Either not cooked right and/or too many spices and salt used that way overpowered anything else. Also while not super pricey, it is a lot more pricey than other places with similar cuisine in the area with much better food. Don't go here unless you want horrible food at a steep price.

EVjO4tg8iQS2l422dzntSA.text: Authentic Taiwanese taste with a contemporary atmosphere, you can watch the chefs behind the glass making noodles.  If you request the table for 4 at the noodle window, you can even watch while you eat!  The wait time varies depending on when you go.  Around 3pm on a Sunday, the wait time was about 5 minutes.  Our server was friendly and willing to explain foods on the menu and demonstrate the proper way to eat the soup dumplings.  The soup dumplings were excellent!  Served in a bamboo steamer, they made a perfect appetizer for 4, but would also be great alone as a meal for 1!    The pork belly bun was amazing!  Be aware, the meat pieces do have a significant amount of fat on them.  It is for flavor, and you don't have to "chew the fat" if you don't want to!    A huge fan of boba tea, their milk tea was exceptional for its size and price. 16 ounces of goodness.  Adding grass jelly was an added bonus!  Also, be aware that the Taiwanese Style Dan Tsu Noodles Soup portion is very large!  It is about 3 times the size of that served in Taiwan.  One bowl is a great size to share with a friend!

YaB9y59JbyA7SiIRDz-1Ug.text: Most of their dishes were really good. Some of their food need more work. Meat dumplings in spicy sauce really need some flavor.  Their bubble milk tea with mango pudding was amazing. The custard buns are unique and taste great. All the noodles I tried in this restaurant were great.  All their food were pretty traditional and nothing like Panda Express.  I will really recommend it if you are a Real Chinese food fan.

bYk6gzJk8H-L2__83_lxcQ.text: I went here yesterday for the first time.  I told the hostess that this was our first time and she seated us at the table in front of the area where they make the noodles.  It was neat to watch these guys ply their craft.   I will agree with some other reviewers that I was expecting there to be more noodle options on the menu since they kind of advertise themselves as having noodles, but after getting past that we dove into the menu to see what we could find.    We started with the onion pancake with sliced beef.  This was amazing.  The dough was flaky, the beef was juicy and tender and the vegetables rolled inside created the perfect combination of taste and texture.  Our second starter was the pork and veggie wontons.  These were tasty and I liked the spicy sauce but I'm not a huge fan of pork wontons so these were the least memorable part of the experience.    For main dishes, my wife got the "dry" hot spicy wonton noodles and I got the "Only Sunday Limited" option of shrimp and loofah soup dumplings.  We both thoroughly enjoyed our dishes.  I got mine because it was on the menu only once a week and I'm glad I did.  Having never had anything like this before, I ordered blindly but figured if they reserve it for only one day a week, it must be special.  And it was.  The loofah soup went perfect with the shrimp and doughy dumpling.  And with a little bit of freshly sliced ginger, these were absolutely delicious.    Although I am not Chinese and so can't comment on the authenticity or how this compares to other people's preparations, I would defintiely recommend trying this restaurant.

xAet-aIDe17GA-q6I8mfog.text: Service was super friendly.  Always a plus in my book.  We ordered the potstickers and those are phenomenal.  Dumplings were good, but nothing spectacular.  Also, I ordered a soup, which was absolutely flavorless and quite disappointing.  The noodles were also super doughy.  However, I will definitely go back as I think this place has great potential.

UoclCBHrkcQecN82nqeltg.text: I have no idea how this place is only rated as 4 stars.  I live in the cleveland area and I have driven there just to have lunch with my family.  The food here is not your typical greasy, salty takeout chinese food.  They have an "open kitchen" concept and you can see the staff making the noodles right in front of you and filling the dumplings with the meat.  The owner is super nice and has often been the one to bring me food.  If you want AUTHENTIC chinese food, you can't beat this place.  If you are visiting pittsburgh, make sure you stop by Jean Marc Chattelier's (across town) to pick up some french dessert as well.  These two are my favorite places in Pittsburgh.  Our favorites: Pork soup dumplings Ox tail soup pork slider minced pork with homemade fresh noodles.

YnqaNa6elqxCyENatGKblQ.text: Yummy and great service (they're really nice!). I love the pudding milk tea and the dandan noodles :3

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steamed pork soup dumpling
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Black tea milk tea with mango pudding and green tea milk tea with caramel pudding :3
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dandan noodles

ckwYaznJE72_cwfhlH3Fqg.text: Never did I think I'd ever see a CLEAN Chinese restaurant in the USA with delicious food and fair prices! This place is the best! It's a modern Chinese restaurant with some very traditional and authentic Chinese food. I ordered the pork soup dumplings for my main dish. The first bite into it brought me back to my childhood in China :) the wrapping is chewy, the filling is savory and the soup is just mouth watering delicious! I also ordered the regular green milk tea. It was a little expensive ($4.50) but I thought I'd give it a try! I was very disappointed with it at first because the tea was absolutely tasteless. My friend got the black milk tea, and she said hers was too sweet. Lol maybe they forgot to add sugar in mine but added too much in hers? We told the server this and she immediately took the teas back and adjusted them to our likings. And they ended up tasting amazing!! What great service! I'm so happy with experience here :)

F8MgSQ9W-G16AZwa_cRz-w.text: Service was super fast and food was really good. They give you a lot for your money and really enjoyed everything we tried. Be warned though that the noise the "noodle making" process makes is actually really loud... I kept jumping in my seat! But it adds a "cool factor" to seeing how they make it and would imagine kids might like to watch. Or an overgrown child such as myself.

JvJal63mzN0yBmcqs4R9fw.text: As far as I know, the only place in Pittsburgh that offers hand-pulled noodles (pulled right in front of you!) and soup dumplings, both of which are amazingly delectable. Heck, this restaurant is likely the only location in this side of Pennsylvania doing what they are doing!

O9Re_ulX67qgU3RpDcaxvQ.text: Loved this place. Decent prices and good food. Really like how I can see the guys making the dumplings!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork Soup dumplings and pot stickers! $9(each)
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Thai ice tea bubble tea! 4.95

ishh3VqnQtzlM6WPUWSWzA.text: So we ordered take out from Everyday Noodles to try it for the first time about two weeks ago.  My wife got flour noodles with chicken and I got rice noodles with beef and we had a side of broccoli.  First off, the noodles weren't bad but the chicken was quite greasy and I was surprised it was on the bone with skin...so it was a lot of work to get to the meat.  The big problem was the broccoli.  We were about halfway through our miniature green trees when my wife noticed something - worms!  YUCK!!  Our cruciferous goodness was ruined!  Probably half the broccoli had worms in it.  Extra protein?  Hmmmm, maybe.  But I called the next day to tell them about it and the woman I spoke to apologized and took my number and said a manager would call me back.  No one ever did.  I was disappointed, to say the least.  We won't be going back to Everyday Noodles.

ywkDo50cZVlo_SNaIhrolw.text: During peak times, you will wait a while. It's worth it, but do yourself a favor and go during an off hour so you can relax and really enjoy your meal.  We haven't ordered anything yet that hasn't been delicious.   If it's your fist time, don't leave without eating the pork soup dumplings.

yEO4bPwdOjG-MsD8KiU_Pw.text: Soup dumplings, other dumplings, delicious soups. The seating is pretty limited at times, but I love the experience. It is really cool to see them make the noodles by hand, and even cooler to taste them. The menu could be a little bit more descriptive at times, but I definitely enjoy the selection.

sB7skxZZ5v3ruSTMiz0nRw.text: Everyday Noodles is probably the best place around to get authentic noodle soups and soup dumplings. All of their noodles are handmade right in the kitchen! Haven't ordered one thing I haven't absolutely loved yet and I don't think I ever will. Not bad prices either for the amount of food you get

p3hZ-4hotHV7PWvk6PyRYQ.text: Its good, and it gets the job done.  I miss Chinese and Taiwanese food so this definitely hit the spot.  But I would normally not be willing to pay what I did for this kind of food.  Granted you can see the chefs making your food and noodles, but still. The food was good, and the service was too, but like I said, that price is not worth it to me.

QCGYaGlKGqNxdaJW-GIlew.text: So many reviews say the same that I would, so I'll be brief.  I've been going steadily since they opened.  My family and I love it every time.  The food and the service!  Sometimes the wait is too long and we have to go elsewhere, but good for them!  Tonight we went early so we wouldn't have to wait.  As usual, the food was fabulous and there service was excellent.  I love how patient the servers are with answering questions and explaining menu items.  We consistently find it one of our favorite places to dine.

jmbLMLS0WlXxOv_lH-YRYQ.text: The food is really fantastic.  And it's dinner and a show for the kids!  Make sure they are sitting where they can watch the noodles being made and they will be entertained the whole meal.  Favorites are the soup dumplings and the spicy Dan Dan noodles.  The veggie sides are also really delicious!

slVbZzgBmu4Kml3pmxfy5A.text: There are a lot of great noodle places on the west coast, and this ranks with the best of them. I went with a friend on a Thursday night around 8PM, and we were seated in 25 minutes. We ordered beef tendon and the Taiwanese pork slider as appetizers, which were quite good.   Our entrees were Dan Dan noodles, which are slightly spicy, but not overly so; I'm South Asian, but my tolerance for heat is low. The mixture of sweet and spicy flavors is one I've never experienced before, and it was delicious! The wide noodles were amongst the best I've ever had.   Desserts were a red bean with sesame seeds pancake, which was decent but nothing to write home about, and what were essentially milk pastries, which were fresh buns drizzled with a condensed milk sauce... Simple, and tasty.   Pricing is on point for a large city, but struck me as mildly high for the desserts, which were the only parts of the meal that weren't a grand slam. Everything was fresh, and the decor was well done. I'm in the DC area, and really wish there was a solid noodle place of this caliber back home.

RNWPip5hRUJgyva5496dsQ.text: Yummy noodles and dumplings in Squirrel Hill. So mesmerizing to watch them make the noodles right there. Great tea selection as well.

BkPaSMxTsZTpE9dQxvMweQ.text: You simply cannot beat this place. Bang for your buck at its finest with some of best noodle dishes I've ever had. The dumplings are to die for. The Pork Potstickers were so moist and flavorful, best dumplings around. This is a staple for us at least once a month. Be aware that when you dine in there is usually a wait on the weekends and the restaurant does tend to get packed in fast. So we tend to go early or go with their quick pick up.  The best part of this place is that everything noodle wise is made in house. You can watch the cooks making the noodles, and when you have them you can really taste the difference. A well priced one of a kind restaurant.

6xDfXVM5m_W1I8DAHM8rUg.text: This place is like Jekyll and Hyde.  When I ate in, I thought the service was excellent and the foods were excellent.  The portion awesome.  When I went back again but wanted a carryout meat over rice dish- I got a lot of rice with with barely any meat.  And they sent me off with a one chopstick (my fault for not making sure I had a set).  I need two chopsticks to make chopsticks work.  But I guess there wasn't much food to eat and one chopstick would do, cause I tossed most of the generous rice away. I speared the two pieces of scallop sized meat  with my one chopstick.  After two bites, my 11 dollars meal was all gone (still had a lot of rice left though and of course one marinated egg - which was a regular sized boil egg).  Overall, unlikely to be going back for carryout, maybe to eat in.  But for sure I will not risk another take out overly generous white rice.    Carryout rating - 1 star Eat In rating - 3 stars Average - 2 stars

qzi5KD-GqyERi6u8N5AsQg.text: My SO and I went last night for dinner. We had the Dan Dan Noodles which I really enjoyed. It had the right amount of vinegar and peanut flavors. We had it with the small noodles.  We had the pork soup dumplings which was amazing as always. The waiter did an awesome job of explaining the proper way to eat them. We had the beef and tendon soup which was supposed to be spicy but wasn't as spicy as we wanted :(.

hKgxnR2gk1dBPExNZwV5Zg.text: Very good! Soup dumplings are great. Sesame rice balls for dessert are delicious, and not too sweet. Small space, but the service is lightening fast, so you won't wait too long for a table. Very nice staff, also.

G3c7-Rzz_b2WY4voVvUwzQ.text: Solid dinner place!  Split dumplings (they were a bit overpriced) but my dry noodle dish and my husbands rice and braised pork dishes were really good.  This is basic, simple, and a good bet.  A bit of a limited menu, but all in all, we enjoyed it very much.  The foods had good flavor.  It was a type of place where you can walk in, grab a table, be in and out in under an hour.  Quick, easy and good.

aBrbam4QwnVIti6KPIEFHQ.text: Broth was the bomb- beef tender and homemade noodles- thin or wide were perfect. Packed with Asian folks so you know you are in the right place.

F8iTOMY39CXJHryGQHNX1A.text: Delicious. The boyfriend and I dined here on a cold, rainy night. I was looking for comfort food after a rough day and the chicken noodle consomme more than delivered. The broth was flavorful, the noodles fresh, the meat was generously portioned and fell off the bone, and the oil with chilies on the side was the perfect condiment. Beyond that, the atmosphere was warm and inviting (perfect for a drizzly evening) and it was nice to be able to see the chefs prepare the food in front of you. I can't wait to come back and try a few other dishes.

KR_gso0Xz8NeJ3ZItS_RvA.text: Maybe the food itself is not 5-star quality per ser, but I just love it when Chinese restaurateurs go a step further to make their diner more unique and less the average American-Chinese restaurant. I enjoyed the overall dining experience: the big kitchen window showing the Chinese chefs making fresh soup dumplings and noodles (very common feature of noodle places in China), the vinegar and ginger slices as side (again, very Chinese), the Chinese characters of "noodles" on the back of their uniforms... The soup dumplings are as authentic as they can get in the States. I also had the pickled cucumber cubes and the wonton in chili oil (Hong You Chao Shou). Both were decent but a little too plain for my taste - after all, both are iconic Sichuan dishes. The chili oil lacks complexity in flavor. The authentic Sichuan chili oil is made with not only chili peppers but also all sorts of spices and herbs, which was absent in their version.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Soup dumplings (Xiao Long Bao) were very authentic. The cucumber salad and the wonton in chili oil were a little plain.

xbBcI3OWywQx_Arp7axygg.text: Friendly service, clean and modern interior, good noodles! Dan Dan noodles wasn't spicy enough for my taste but I'm coming back for more.

EjV0FeUczH1ZFv6gvNu9HA.text: Best place ever.  Seriously. Amazing!!!  It takes effort for us to not come here every time we go out to eat. I'm still grateful to the dude that turned us into this place because we would skip it because the name is so lack luster.   We get the pork soup buns- every.single.time.  And if you are there on a Sunday don't fall for the Sunday only version on the soup bun... just get this one. You'll thank me.  Also you have to get the chili paste to dip it in before dropping this delicious and delicate morsel of joy in your mouth. Again, you'll thank me.  We also get the shrimp and vegetable shao mai. Yum again.  Finally we get the thin Dan Dan noodles. Hella good. Pretty much everything we try is good. These are our favorites.  The staff are always welcoming and friendly. It's a busy place and the tables are pretty close together. It's not a fancy place but it's comfy.   This place is in a little shopping area with locally owned businesses. Parking is on street with a couple of garages close by.

Ofm9yLtsYiwnWoxaYzcg0w.text: Simply amazing. Honestly surprised to find such great Chinese food in Pittsburgh. Must try the soup dumplings - delicious !!

MllaySFCWrtodoW6vnr6xw.text: The spicy beef noodle soup is delicious! It's my favorite bowl of soup in Pittsburgh. I'm new to the city and this is one of my favorite restaurants I've discovered here. I always order the soup dumplings which never disappoint. I will admit I'm a bit of a soup snob, BUT I will say the broth here lacks consistency. Sometimes the beef broth has a strong boney flavor, other times it lacks spice and is watery. The noddles never disappoint and are perfect with the right amount of chew.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

hVyV35vAdi9bbyVyn57v8g.text: Great for your Chinese food/noodle soup craving, but doesn't compare to other major cities (especially not NYC or anyplace in China). The soup dumplings were small and had almost no soup - I wasn't sure if they are freshly made there or if they were frozen - because they seemed frozen. The noodles are handmade though (you can see them being made) and good.  I can appreciate that Pgh has some more authentic Chinese restaurants to choose from now.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lamb noodle soup

Mcoj5I0kZ1sqWaep1R8eqQ.text: If you like authentic Chinese food, do not walk but run to Everyday Noodles right now!   It didn't seem like we had a choice but to order the pork soup dumplings ($9). OH. EM. EFFING. GEE. They were amazing. Delicious is not even a word that I can use to describe them, because it's not enough. The broth inside was so flavorful. These are a must-get if you are visiting.  We also ordered Dan Dan Noodles Szechuan Style ($7) and the Hot Spicy Wonton dry noodles ($7). They were both really good, but the Hot Spicy Wonton was definitely my fave. We ordered wide noodles with both of them and I'm glad we did. The noodles were the perfect amount of chewy!  One thing to note about the Dan Dan - it's SUPER peanutty which is a-ok in my book, but it can be overwhelming after a whole dish of them so bear that in mind as you make your choices.  I also had a cup of the green tea, which was perfect as it's a super chilly day out.  All in all, the whole meal ran us under $30 and was so satisfying. I cannot wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nice cup of green tea on this chilly day. The tea is not complimentary - it is $2.50.
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dan Dan Noodles Szechuan Style - very peanutty and delicious! Just the right amount of spice.

WrOIwniTA3ruG8Xe152mDg.text: The most fascinating thing for me about this place is watching the preparation of noodles and dumplings. I always try to get the table across the glass window through which I can watch them prepare noodles and dumplings. However, there will be periodic "thud...thud...thud...thud...." sound when they knead the dough before stretching it to make the noodles.   The only meat I eat is chicken. So, there are not many options for me on the menu. I usually get the veggie noodles and  dumplings. Though the options are limited, I still go there for two reasons. One reason is the fresh and subtle flavours of the noodles and the delicious broth. Secondly, for the best dumplings I ever had.

XkMsS18n35Z5q5ShAoSdOQ.text: I get this place once every 2 weeks! Love the dumplings and noodle dishes!! I'm a vegetarian and always get the veg dumplings or the Dan dan noodles vegetarian style which you can ask for!

pCkJ8XX_N6rjrsDrQO_69w.text: It's really nice and affordable for its quality. The noodles are of good quality and the environment is great. There's a line on weekends, so beware.

t5D9DXAruMtzM6IW3RLhHg.text: Seated very quickly! Their food has a lot of flavor. Maybe too much flavor if anything but overall a great experience. We ate every single bite of our 3 dumpling orders and soup. Large portions were worth the $.

ynVpLdiRQXSsPO72lY6s_g.text: Very unhappy with the Wonton soup. Way too much fat in the broth. We ordered the Wonton soup and Beef noodle soup, both came with the same broth which left us dissapointed. Hard to eat due to all the grease in it.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

8bIsd1g7SLd6DkvLQ1zFag.text: Wow, just wow.  Pickled mustard green and pork soup -incredible.  Pork belly slider - fantastic. Pork soup dumplings- umm, phenomenal.  Service with a smile. Food cooked right in the open kitchen and nothing disappointed. Small, so there may be a wait, but worth every minute.

lwaf-pWlS6D9q46oNwmbUw.text: This was a great Taiwanese noodle restaurant! We came on Christmas Day and were happy they were opened. I ordered a minced pork noodle (they are hand drawn at the restaurant and you can watch them!) which was very delicious. The portions are average in size and were on the more expensive side. We also had pork soup dumplings, which were steamed very well. The service was average, but the food was served within minutes! I would recommend this place for anyone who likes noodles and bubble tea too. Blessings!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

6TPpV0IVo_ARKCMPPs1x3Q.text: Great place if you are looking for authentic dim sums and noodles soups! We visited this place on our recent trip to Pittsburgh and one day was not enough for us to savor these amazing dim sums. We came back the second day as well to get some more dim sums. The Pork Soup Dumplings are heavenly. You can simply get these and feel lucky you came to this place. They make it right in front of you and you will be amazed at the amount of dumplings they can get done in 15-20 mins.   Also, the Braised Pork Belly over Rice and Lamb Noodle Soup Consomme was very tasty too! We also tried the Pan Fried Pork Bun which was very nice - it is different than the traditional BBQ Pork Buns who may have had at other places but it is quite good. We also got the Pan Fried Green Onion Pancake which was okay. You can also get Bubble Tea at this place which I believe is a bonus. Staff is friendly and service is fast. Very highly recommend this place to all dim sum lovers. Enjoy!

zIOPNn8tX-LGHpoC8ZMnBw.text: First time here. The whole meal was great but make sure you save room for the sesame balls, so yummy!

8KStr91O7sn_bnh4DSE--g.text: This is my favorite restaurant within a 1-2 mile radius of CMU campus. In fact, the menu is taped on my wall above my desk in my dorm room. I typically get the hot and spicy wonton noodles or Dan Dan noodles. Today, I ordered the Shrimp, Pork, Vegetable Wontons and was not disappointed. It was fairly spicy but the flavors are authentic and, as with all other items on the menu, the handmade noodles are a wonderful touch. The waiting times on weekends tend to be a little longer but when I went on Thursday night, I was immediately seated and received my food quite promptly. If I had to eat these noodles everyday I would not be mad.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp, Pork, Vegetable Wontons with Mung Bean Noodles, Sichuan Style

NQW9KrKLw5bZcCWed-NRDA.text: Interior: the inside is very nicely decorated. They put strings on the walls so they look like noodles! Haha I thought that was clever. I also love that part of the kitchen can be seen through the window where you can watch the chefs make dumplings. In fact, you can choose to sit at a table that is right in front of the window. So dinner and a show?  Food: the food was around $10 so it's pretty reasonable. I got some Taiwanese Style Dan Tsu noodles and shared pork soup  dumplings with my friend. The noodles I got was good, though I think the other choices with more meat would be better so I plan on trying that next time. I thought everything tasted authentic though. Particularly after a string of bad restaurants I went to in Pittsburgh, I was pleasantly surprised by Everyday Noodles.   Overall, Everyday Noodles has nice decor, decently delicious and authentic food, and fairly cheap prices. Warrants a 4 star in my book. I would come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GAorMQsCyPp8cR_0DTo1Sw.text: I've been to Everyday noodles a couple times.  I can't say enough about this place.  Both experiences were phenomenal.    I will say, I should have read the reviews before I went the first time - I would have gotten the soup dumpling then!    My first visit we got WAY too much food for 2 people, but we also didn't know what to expect.  We got a side of veggies, 2 dry noodle choices, a dim sum pork belly, and an order of some dumplings.  OBVIOUSLY way too much food for 2 people - but we sure did give it an honest effort.  With the inexpensive pricing, we expected small portions.  Little did we know!  However, it made fantastic leftovers!  They did bring food out as it was ready - so we got it in an interesting order.  But no complaints here!  We also had the best seats in the house - right where they were making noodles in front of us.  I was in awe the whole time watching the process.    My second visit...THIS was Soup Dumpling time.  My friend had never been there, and again, we got the best seats in the house!  I was bummed though, as they must have been done making noodles for the day.  My friend and I were unsure how to eat them, so our waiter was kind enough to show us (without making us feel like idiots).  This time - we didn't go crazy with the food.  We each got a dry noodle dish, soup dumplings and something else small that we shared.  It was pure perfection.    The staff, the food, the atmosphere - all were perfection.  I am looking forward to going back - MANY MANY many times.  (I've already got a couple times with friends planned!)

lQJdoUDLuk1lZ6NAlK_oNg.text: I really enjoy this place. The pork belly buns are the star! The food is full of flavour. All the standards feature on the menu.

KZwiifRJ6-Zc5peTs9ILgg.text: I'm officially in love.  The soup dumplings are little balls of liquidy heaven.  The pot stickers are also my jam.  It has definitely become our go-to place when we venture into the city (since we are typically stuck in a suburban chain-restaurant nightmare).

_oOyCMcFTBiP2bVpfLXLhA.text: We're here Saturday at 7:30pm - no wait and service was super fast. The beef noodles and soup dumplings are amazing. If we lived in the area I'd definitely come back!

b08wqpBBBXKOUCU7qB_jYA.text: Very good soup dumpling and green onion pancake. The drunken chicken was fine but not as expected. It's a cold, fatty, spicy chicken sliced. If I could do it over I'd skip that and have gotten another dumpling.

20Om3knj8AhN437JogXbrg.text: Excellent food, especially the soup dumplings. It is entertaining to watch them make the noodles. But their dumplings are far better than their noodles. As far as noodles, Noodlehead is far better.

sNsTqxfV_udcnnzuHWRx3g.text: Maybe it was just what we ordered but the noodles and broth were bland and the broccoli was over cooked and oddly seasoned.

OZmyBoabfxKxrIbJHtoKEw.text: So happy to find this place after moving from an area of LA that had incredible dumpling/noodle houses on every corner!    Delicious pork and vegetable dumplings and cold soba noodle dish.  The Taiwanese soup was also tasty.  Very attentive staff and comfortable, modern setting in the dining room.  It's a very popular spot so just be prepared to wait upwards of 1 hr for a table at times.

V7NVK3DP8-3PUi_nB_fm4A.text: Just got to the place @ 1:50 pm on a Sat. The place is packed. Greeted by the hostess and was told that they only do take out cuz it closed @ 2:30 pm. Really? On a Sat when it takes like 1/2 hr to find parking around the area.

Wx0Ii05Kg8_lLtpInOEbPQ.text: I am really torn between a 3 and 4 star review, but I don't think it deserves a 3...So maybe a 3.5... I really enjoyed coming here. It had a nice atmosphere and they have it set-up where you can watch the chefs crank out the noodles. We ordered the soup dumplings, pan fried pork buns, and a pork belly 'slider'. I put Slider in quotes because the thing was quite massive...even between us two it was a struggle to eat it, but it was very good, as well as the pork buns. My only gripe was the soup dumplings were a bit of a letdown. While I though the texture and meat were nice, the broth was not good, at times tasting like dirty meat water or something.. (Don't ask me how I would even know what that tastes like) I was expected much more from the dumplings, and was a bit let down. Overall I still enjoyed coming here, and I think i would give them another chance if given the opportunity

qzKQfDfF4xg4lWkZU-rCYQ.text: The pork soup dumplings are DELICIOUS. This was my first time here and I was pretty impressed with the food.   The decor is very updated, and we were seated right away. The waiter came up to us pretty promptly and took our order. Being a first timer, when our dumplings came out the woman gave us an introduction to how to eat them properly. It was a pretty cool thing.   They didn't have a huge selection in terms of options, but I could've just eaten the pork soup dumplings and I would've been a happy camper. The only slightly negative thing I would say was that once the waiter came over it was far and few between to see him again. It also took a long time for them to drop our check.  All in all, I'd visit again if I was in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way.

UzztdZXsIZehKMYp0-jrAA.text: Noodles with minced pork sauce is amazing! I absolutely loved it. It looks and tastes very similar to the Korean "Jjajangmyeon." Also, their pork soup dumplings are really good. I wish they were a bit bigger, though. This is the only place I've seen that has pudding as a topping for bubble tea. I tried the coffee bubble tea with caramel pudding and it has got to be in my top 2 favorite bubble teas, tied with the I Tea Milk Bubble Tea from I Tea Cafe.

nPTLNN7FpRX2ohTYbA4dOA.text: I love how the restaurant is set up so that you can see all the chefs making noodles from scratch.  I also love the kind-of-tight-but-somehow-very-cozy atmosphere.    The ramen is pretty good, but far from amazing.  The veggie dumplings, however, are bangin'.  Overall, I think Ramen Bar (which is right across the street from Everyday Noodles) is better.  But Everyday Noodles is certainly worth a trip.

6_O32vNtOprcU38wAg9MBA.text: My son is standing beside me arguing for three stars because the beef in our beef soup was fatty.  I actually had two pieces that were really good.  So let's settle for quality is inconsistent.   The portions of soup are enormous.  We heavily over ordered.  As I like ramen when I have a cold, I will come back here or ask for take out in the future.  Some say the soup is bland, but I would say it is light.  The potstickers were very flavorful and fresh.  For dessert we had the blackbean pancakes and the sweet yolk buns.  I thought both were delicious.  We had a friend with us who is gluten free, so the choice of rice noodles worked out well.

UlVjquy24l9pPR8QxvKdwA.text: Ok,  I dont eat pork or shellfish - so what I could try was limited.    We had the beef soup.  Noodles were great - you could tell they were fresh.    Meat was in very large chunks - thought it would be a problem, but it was tender.  We also had vegetable dumplings, and they were also very good.

DjlR0KAb87m-CZbU8-0mRg.text: Today was my first time going here, and I must say it was amazing !!! The workers were awesome and all the food was even better! Everyone must try the pork dumplings, I will for sure be coming back.

AqNSBmcnQNas8HYt405xVg.text: This place is awesomesauce!  One of the most authentic noodle/dumpling house I've been to since Taiwan.  It's great fun to see the cooks creating the noodles - even though I jumped a few times from all the loud pounding.  Kinda surprised that there are no savory bun options on the dim sum menu (I'd love to see some in the future).  But, what they do offer is delectable.  Definitely try the soup dumplings!  If you've never had them, make sure to ask your waitress how to eat them.  It's also wonderful to find a place that serves varieties of bubble milk tea with your food (though I hope to see fruit bubble teas and ice blended versions eventually).    This restaurant would be getting 5 stars, except the prices are pretty hefty.  It's understandable, what with the location and lack of competition.  However, most items are $2-$3 more than you'd pay at any other noodle house in Philly or NYC.  We might all be paying for the "noodle show", which I can understand.  Also, some people mention huge portions; We didn't experience that.  Still, the quality is certainly there!

GTnQ5BcMQETHDoHOGxy1Fw.text: I've been here twice, once not long after they opened and once last Dec.  On my first visit, I ordered the dry Dan-Dan noodles, as well as an appetizer of the wood ears and tofu skins to share.  In that appetizer, I enjoyed the tofu skins much more than the wood ears, which surprised me since I'm not a tofu aficionado, but I think it was due to the unique texture (thin and rolled up).  The Dan Dan noodles were okay, but their flavor became a bit monotonous after a bit--the dish could use some variety in flavor.  It's very filling, however, since it's huge; I was only able to eat half, and took the other half home for later consumption (the flavor was just as monotonous the next day).  The second time, I ordered the pork and crab meat soup dumplings, per a friend's recommendation.  They were much better than the Dan Dan noodles.  They're little pouches filled with soup, pork, and crab meat.  When I ate them, I felt like they bursted in my mouth with warmth and flavor!  The filling was a bit on the salty side, but was otherwise delicious.  I also ordered the sliced seaweed w/ garlic appetizer, which wasn't very memorable.  My dining partner ordered the Dan Dan noodles, and ended up leaving half of them on his plate when we left, so I guess I'm not the only one who's less-than-enthusiastic about this dish (also, see other reviews).  The ambience is interesting--there's always a guy in the front making the noodles, and it's fun to see how they're made.  You order by filling out a slip indicating your selections.  Service has always been fine.

YT9DCnqSn9YdRROErLCyjg.text: This place is great! We've eaten here a few times and have never been disappointed. Very authentic flavors with noodles made in house. I've had several different dishes here and all have been spectacular. My favorite dish is the Spicy Wonton Noodles. It has a great balance of flavor with the right amount of heat. The Pork Soup Dumplings are also not to be missed. They are warm and hearty and have great texture. The service is fast and friendly, and they turn tables over quickly. If you haven't eaten here yet, definitely give it a try.

s_ehq9bQA7IZIUtEbbozjg.text: Yum!  I think I had the pork noodle soup - but definitely the fresh noodles in it.  You get a choice of several different kinds, including rice and flour.  The kitchen is open and you can watch them making the noodles; it's a fascinating process.  There was enough soup in the gigantic bowl for three people, too, and the prices are very modest indeed, so it's a fantastic value.    I will definitely return to sample other things on the menu.  It's very telling that the place was packed with Asian people, several of whom were kind enough to point out what they were eating when I asked.

6No9GOUoV4a7_C5CZW066Q.text: I have stopped by here twice now, most recently this afternoon with my father for lunch.  The inside of this restaurant is modern and clean with some nice soothing colors.  My favorite part of the restaurant is the big clear window that allows you to see the chef making the fresh noodles and the tables in front of it which position you for the perfect view of it.  For my lunch entree, I decided to go with the pickled mustard green with pork noodle soup while my father went with the chicken noodle soup.  We both chose to have our soup with thin flour noodles when given the option between rice noodles and thick or thin flour noodles.  Besides the soups we also decided to go with a dry noodle and decided to split the hot and spicy wonton noodles which I had on my first visit.  The hot and spicy wonton noodles came out first and was a bowl of noodles topped with six wontons and a spicy sauce.  The noodles had a springy texture and were nice to eat while the wontons tasted nicely as well.  While both of those components were good I think that the spicy sauce really made the dish.  As my dad said, "the more that I eat of the dish, the spicier it gets"  which I agreed with and loved.  After we were finished with the dry noodles our noodle soups came out next.  The bowls are quite large and could easily be a meal themselves.  The broth of mine had a good flavor and while the pork didn't do too much for me, I loved the sourness of the pickled mustard greens.  Whenever I got some I felt like it balanced out the soup perfectly.  Much like the dry noodles I thought that the noodles of my soup had some great texture with a bit of springiness.  My dad was also happy with his soup of which the protein consisted of four pieces of skin on-bone in chicken which he thought was flavorful.  The bottom line for me is that we will definitely be back here again in the future.  I love that this place has great flavors and is reasonably priced and I could see it being the perfect dining spot on a cold Pittsburgh day.

S1b0_Rgi5g1lISlyr1pW9g.text: Had an amazing dinner there. The noodles are simply amazing! Definitely would recommend. They have a little something for all taste buds.

ElWzLUSnyG3XepqOBsY-hw.text: I really want to love this place, but it's just not happening. There are many good things about this place; the service, the atmosphere, the hand-pulled noodles, but the quality of the dishes really ruin it for me.  We went in to place an order for takeout. We grabbed a menu on the way in and waited at the counter. There was a good variety of dishes on the menu including dumplings, soup, and dry noodles, basically what you would expect from a noodle place. The people behind the register were very friendly and ordering was a smooth process.  We did not stay and eat inside, but the place looked beautiful. Nicely laid out, very modern design and decor, and you could see everything that was happening in the kitchen through the glass divider separating it from the dining area. It was pretty busy inside, but did not feel overcrowded. They had just reopened for dinner and it was already packed inside, so I think calling ahead of time would be a good choice if you plan on getting a table.  I ordered the Braised Beef Noodle Soup (my usual go-to for noodle soups) and my partner ordered the Oxtail Noodle Soup. Each were $11. We also got an order of the Pork Soup Dumplings for $9, which was a lot more than I wanted to spend. We sat outside at the tables and chairs in front of the place and about 10 minutes later we were given our food.  We got home quickly and got everything ready to eat. The noodles and broth came in separate containers so the noodles don't get soft and mushy before you get a chance to eat.  Here is what I enjoyed: the noodles.  The noodles were very delicious and fresh tasting. They were done very well and I loved them. I've had other noodles that compare to these, but they still stand out on the top of my list.  Here is what I did not enjoy: everything else.  Both broths were very bland. I thought the oxtail broth tasted better than the braised beef, because it had that meaty/boney flavor, but it still wasn't anything special. It was almost like sipping water that had a very, very light beef flavor to it. We had to add a ton of soy sauce and salt just to add any sort of taste to it.  The braised beef that was included in my soup was fatty and hard to eat. I feel like the meat was there just for looks, because it added nothing in terms of flavor to the soup and was next to impossible to chew and swallow.  The dumplings were the worst. The portion was rather small for the price, which I have already griped about above, and the flavor was terrible. The dumplings were very moist turning the insides into a gross, pork puree. I've had dumplings at other places and have made my own many times and I have never eaten a batch quite like this. Of the 8 dumplings, we ate 3 before giving up.  So for $30+ we had two orders of good noodles soaking in near tasteless broth full of fatty inedible pieces of meat and a side of unenjoyable dumplings.  I feel like our meal was not worth the money we paid at all. If our bill was half of what we actually paid, I would suck it up and say, "hey, it wasn't that bad considering the price", but I really expected a lot more from this.  I don't think I'll give this place another try any time soon as I was very disappointed. It's just another notch in my belt on my search for good noodles and dumplings in Pittsburgh.

OlrfgyTJ140kmsMsnrKxDw.text: I can't find any fault with the place, even if I tried. I'm still getting used to szechuan food, but it was great here. Amazing service, and nice environment.

4mRl03uzU08UUrLhlpA93A.text: These are some seriously addicting soup dumplings.   I'm from New York and around the city and in Queens, there are many soup dumpling houses. I've had good, I've had bad, and I've had amazing. These ones are incredible.   5 of us ordered 3 orders of pork soup dumplings, and 2 ordered of crispy mini milk buns. The wait time for the food was practically non-existent. The piping hot dumplings were delivered to our table in no time. The soup inside were delicious, but these were a little delicate. The addition of the chili oil was the icing on the cake. They were perfect, and I had 5 to myself.   The crispy mini milk buns were also delicious. They were brought over just as we were finishing our soup dumplings. They were hot and fresh. Eat bite was crispy, sweet, and just heavenly.   This place is a serious dim sum contender and everyone should come here and order the entire menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crispy mini buns
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork soup dumplings

je4pPkt4lPu8wQKTnM1msQ.text: Since moving from Pittsburgh, we realized how much we miss this place. It was our Saturday morning staple for a long time. The pork soup dumplings, pork vegetable wontons, and boba are still favorites to this day.

AW396g9vBC8-WvP0Jz_DCA.text: Amazing! They make the noodles and dumplings fresh right in front of you. Prices are fair and everything we had was delicious. Good for vegetarians and pescatarians.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Noodle wonton soup and spicy peanut noodles.
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegetable dumplings. Made fresh in house!
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bok choy

end1oEg9IzrDrFDMgJ5gYA.text: My favorite authentic Asian cuisine!  Soup noodles and pickled ginger are my favorite but nothing I've tried was bad!

25oe-4K0wsgFAYzaNEGUXg.text: Every time I go to Pittsburgh, I make it a point to stop at Everyday Noodles for lunch or dinner. This is the closest restaurant to me (Clevelander) that serves authentic, fresh soup dumplings (xiao long bao). The pork soup dumplings are divine, and a must-order if you are planning to stop at this restaurant. Granted, the soup dumplings are not as good as the ones you can get in New York or California, but they are still extremely high quality, made fresh daily. Everyday Noodles also has some nice bubble tea, but not too different from other boba places in the area. The rest of the menu, imo, is not too different from other Taiwanese restaurants in the area. It's definitely the xiao long bao that make this place stand out, and the major reason I have to come here on my Pittsburgh trips.

n7nJzWURyuiUSvzNXpBpVg.text: As a noodle fan, it's good to go! The size per serving is good enough for one adult. We ordered roast beef noodle and sour & spicy pork noodle, both served in soup, they taste good! Recommending for northerners who loves noodles.

szuzalTK36Q7dyPbLGwsAw.text: Always fast, always good food! My favorites are the seaweed salad, soup dumplings and braised beef soup. They make their own noodles and dumplings. Best Chinese in Pittsburgh!

rOSVz1nsyIgHzLuNTLML2Q.text: Finally an authentic noodle house in Pittsburgh.  We live in Southern California and the Chinese restaurants were plenty.  It was a relief for us to find this gem in Squirrel Hill, Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

aDX1FZfieRwfbpid6QR8gA.text: Busy place. Simple setup. Tables are close to each other, which I don't mind, since I can "window shop" before I order ;D Two words: soup dumplings. Get them.

D-fVkeFU85yhVUaaw6FM4Q.text: The wait time wasn't bad. Took about 20 minutes to get a table on a Sunday afternoon. I've heard good stuff about this place. I usually go to sun penang for dim sum but love soup dumplings, something that my place doesn't have.   Service was fast and friendly. The owner always came over to joke around with us. The waitress was fast and I like the sheet you fill out with a pencil.   I also thought it was cool you could see the cook staff through the window making noodles and wontons. They wear funny masks which I assume is so they don't cough or sneeze on your food. Looks kinda dorky and the running joke was that we were the first people to breathe on our food.   The food itself was alright. Pot stickers were my favorite. The watercress was good although I think they fried it instead of steaming it which was different.   The soup dumplings loofah were delicious. I really liked how perfectly they came out.   I'm a little torn because the minced pork thin noodles and the ox tail soup were kind of bland. Nothing really screamed delicious. You could actually taste the flower which was pretty good but the broth/sauce left more to desire.   I'd definitely come back again but stay away from the noodles dishes and get more appetizers/dim sum. Kind of defeats the purpose of calling your restaurant everyday noodles when your side dishes are better than the main meal!!

vLX_1OPrwSfeYdCaOB9_6Q.text: We like a lot of the menu. Good options for vegetarians. Lots of hungry people always there, everyone seems to be enjoying their meals. Chowing down. Simple dishes, cooked right. Get to watch the noodle makers slam the dough. Good for families. Quick take out.
