b1rvVhSw0d0BtmOepA-wUQ.text: Thoroughly enjoyed our dinner out at Everyday Noodles. It's delightful to watch them pull the noodles at the front of the house. We had soup dumplings, broccoli, potstickers, hot spicy wonton noodles, and braised beef noodle soup. We could eat those soup dumplings, broccoli, and potstickers all day long! Delicious. I had the spicy wonton noodles, and they were a high but manageable spice level. They're advertised as dry, which means they don't have a sauce component. That was fine, and the texture was great. I will try something else next time, though. My husband had the braised beef noodle soup and loved it. It has a strong Chinese five spice background, so don't get it if that's not for you. Looking forward to our next visit to try more!

2pjZlYfU9bbHiPt-W-MmnQ.text: The food here is amazing and very reasonably priced! Most items are under $10 and portions are huge! I recommend the wonton soup,  braised beef noodle soup or soup dumplings!

0IfCWUQe15-_BKpqWN8xRg.text: Decided to try this place because it was listed online as one of the top 30 places to dine in Pittsburgh. We didn't make reservations and the dining room was full. They do have a couple long tables similar to bar seating, which is where we ate.   Unsure of what to try we decided to order several dishes and share. The server asked our likes and wants followed by several recommendations of her popular dishes and favorites.  We choose a spicy dumpling and noodle dish, soup dumplings, and pan fried dumplings.  This would have been plenty for two but we also went with the eggplant appetizer  (served cold). The food came out in waves, quickly and hot. The soup dumplings are a must try and carried the best flavor. I'd prefer some additional dipping sauces outside of the ginger and dumpling sauce they provide.   The restaurant also offers delivery and pick up. No alcohol on site but the table behind us had a bottle of wine so I assume they're BYOB. I would recommend a reservation,  but table turnover seems quick so wait time shouldn't be too long. There are lots of other shops in the area so if you can get a seat, I'd give it a shot. Quick and delicious Asian cuisine at a very reasonable price.

20xwqjKMpu8zjjzFFtXShA.text: This is REAL Hongkong noodle!! Steamed Dumplings are fantastic! I like Jasmine tea here~~U can't miss it!! ,,,~!!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. EVERYDAY NOODLES
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. EVERYDAY NOODLES
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Noodle Soup Consommé

HeuUJfNmuekV_8UDCXAQDw.text: I love this place! I always order the pork soup dumplings and they're always consistent and amazing! I always order extra ginger with them because there's no other way to eat them

1T-G8nZG8NLVBbCkE4rbVw.text: OMG, the soup dumplings.  If you've never had a soup dumpling, it's basically wonton soup inside of a paper thin steamed dumpling.  It's otherwise known as a party in my mouth.    This place was great.  The food came incredibly quickly (almost too quickly?  Is that a legitimate criticism?) and everything tasted fresh and delicious.  We were there late on a Sunday night so we didn't get to see the noodle-making in action, but I would imagine that it's pretty cool to watch.  The staff were very friendly and everything was well-priced.  The only negative thing I could say about Everyday Noodles is that while it's beautifully decorated and has a great atmosphere, it's not really a place where I'd feel comfortable lingering over a dinner or on a romantic date - the vibe is more "in and out" even though you're sitting down.  But don't let that prevent you from eating here - highly recommended!

rSfso8yB9geklzh2pn8fbg.text: XIAO LONG BAO! Freakin' delicious. Rivals the soup dumplings I've had in other major cities.  I'm super glad that Pittsburgh is expanding it's Asian food scene...and a legit one at that.   The honorable mention: baby bok choy (a tad over cooked, but still delicious), shrimp pot stickers.  The noodles- we tried the dan dan noodles, and easily one of the worst representations of its kind.. no joke. Sauce was not tasty and the texture of noodles was a disappointment, especially considering that it's their specialty.  Service is fast, but friendly. Space is small and it's meant to fit as much people  as it can. Table are meant to be shared with other parties (the bar-ish seating in front of the open air kitchen), and conversations will not be private. This is just a simple place to enjoy some great dumplings.

l2y07GLLS_9_bOFFLpTJbw.text: Went there on a Monday about lunch time and were seated rather fast almost right in front of the glass window, kitchen staff was rolling out dumplings, trays of them, it was a treat to watch the food being prepared.  The Decor was nice inside and it seemed a bit busy. Our food did come out in bits and pieces, though we all shared, overall I was not too impressed with the taste, we had a cold noodle chicken dish, lamb & noodles, chicken & noodles.. maybe I had high expectations... a plus is that they have bubble tea, the price was ok, maybe a little high but ok, I'd recommend to go once, but not sure if I'd care to return again.

B0AbJErxLdSgWjJFns3RUg.text: All business and no joking at EN, so..  130 on Friday, almost full. Nice array of seats: 2-top table-booths with a solo counter and larger parties near the back, bright gold / bamboo vibe helped by bright wood floors. A Healthy mix of white and Asian guests in the generally-white sq hill neighborhood.  Service is fast after filling out the card. Tendon arrived in 3 minutes and noodles another 4. Dumplings were after a out 12 minutes.   Tendon - rich, beefy stock, onions small and needing more salt. Very large plate, gonna be filling. Inconsistent texture.. Some wonderfully crunchy, some so mushy its beef-stock marinated pearl onions.  Dan Dan noodles sat for 2 minutes upon arrival and were mushy by then. Super rich with an extremely heavy peanut flavor, thick and creamy texture helping overwhelm, some sirachra spice and roasted garlic peaking through from time-time. Some aromatic vinegar and brown sugar-molasses as well. Overall its an intoxicating, overwhelming experience and acid / crunch are needed desperately.  Soup dumplings - pretty much perfect. Lightly oily, great texture, juicy as hell with enough salt. The shredded ginger provides the acid.  Ate 2/3 of the tendon, half the noodles, and all 8 dumplings. Was stuffed. Had to box my own to-go. :(  Will make many more trips for the dumplings, might try other stuff. In, out, all business.

k19DmR6EW9nFWbebe2QdIA.text: the first time I ate here was while I was visiting pittsburgh, and it definitely left poor expectations of this place. but thankfully after trying a couple more times while now living in pittsburgh, it's a great place to go for noodles! more specifically, I'm a noodle soup fanatic and going here for sure quenches my cravings! I haven't tried all of their noodle soups but most of them are good and worth trying. I like to get the OX TAIL CONSUME and WONTON NOODLE SOUP.  their service is fairly quick & friendly. as expected from asian restaurants they give you the check while you're still eating but don't take that as a rude gesture. and your food comes out way faster than you'd expect!  the interior is pretty crowded as you can tell that they tried to put as many seats as possible in a small space. that said, plan in advance when to come since their wait during meal times are pretty long. they have a window for customers to watch the chefs make hand-pulled noodles and soup dumplings, it's very entertaining!   tldr; food 4.5/5 service 5/5 interior 4.5/5 timeliness 5/5

lHdymi99VvX-Pb-Rlpdzeg.text: There are competitors, even in walking distance to Everyday Noodles, for authentic Asian cuisine in the Pittsburgh area, but none of them hold a candle to this place. I live 45 minutes away from this restaurant but have gone back to it time and time again since I discovered it last fall, and the food is perfect every time. The Sichuan style dan dan noodles are out of this world delicious. The wonton noodle soup is also not to be missed. The crowning achievement for Everyday Noodles, however, are their pork soup dumplings, which are the singular best thing on the menu. My friend always gets the pork belly over rice, which is very good as well. I often go for my usual, but I haven't tried a thing on this menu I haven't liked. It's always very clean and the staff is always very friendly, but if you go at peak times, be prepared to wait. It's a small restaurant and it's always crowded. But good things come to those who wait. And to those that drive a little further out of their way.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steamed egg yolk buns
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork soup dumplings

T4OT2Adwts7k3IKzUwhkJg.text: We had lunch there today. There is hair in the beef noodle soup . We told the waitress but she didn't even care . That was so gross I almost threw up. Sorry not anymore.

raHF_gI0Dd4miqQLWeLTsQ.text: Visited Pitt from New York City and was pleasantly surprised how good their Asian food is. Everyday noodles had a great variety of items on their menu and was vegetarian friendly.  It hit the spot!  Watching the kitchen magically turn dough into noodles and stuffed dumplings was an additional treat. Unlike Nyc, this restaurant offers a tasty meal that is affordable. The main attraction, though, was how friendly the staff and owner were. Mike Chan is a restaurant visionary who is humble and kind. In summary, if you live in Pitt, it would be wise to make this rest your "go too". If you are visiting, hitting up this place will be well with it.

orPlFVxs9Vx2V_HvHRYUMg.text: Mmm the noodles here are so delicious. The texture is incredible-- which comes from them being hand pulled! I got the Taiwanese Dan Su noodles, and the flavor was delicious! A little bit small on the meat side, but the taste of the meal was great. My favorite part of noodle soups is always the boiled egg, and the flavor was completely soaked into the egg. Also got a taro bubble tea, and it was a huge portion! A little sweet, but overall tasty. I would highly recommend for authentic noodles!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dan Tsu Noodles - not a lot of meat but good flavoring

opy-uehkYQCruAQ9SorUtQ.text: I went here for the first time during my summer as an intern here and WOW... the BEST soup dumplings I have EVER tried. I literally contemplate driving all the way out to Squirrel Hill from the North Hills every time I crave them... and usually cave.   I also love the Braised Beef Noodle Soup. It's spicy and it is good, really good. The braised beef is super tender and just falls apart with chopsticks, the vegetables in the soup are cooked to perfection and not soggy and the broth itself really packs a punch. It clears your sinuses out, for sure.   There are bar-style seats near the kitchen and you can see the chefs prepare the noodles, which come either flat or round. It's neat seeing how authentic it is and how much time and effort they put into the meals!  If you're out in the Squirrel Hill area, you've got to check this place out. Get a bubble tea with your meal to get the full experience!

PhIdPc7i_I2y6-Q8fmEcEA.text: The food is awesome, this place is very much worth the wait, the braised beef with rice was my favorite but the steamed dumplings were to die for as well. I can't wait to come back to this place

nSzvw5yyWT6Xe5APp6YHfg.text: The perfect place for warm noodles on a cold night. Casual yet warm ambiance, not too loud. Love the couch seat and chair option. Food seems authentic and fresh. Had the noodle soup with chicken--tasty warm broth. My family had the braised beef over rice and said it was very tasty. The pork soup dumplings are yummy. My jasmine tea had a fancy tea bag. A favorite place to go.

aBfaUM5nCAmdjm1XTxLS8Q.text: Best trendy noodle bar I've ever eaten at!  The Dan Dan noodles are fantastic, shiitake and bamboo shoots were the perfect salty starter, and the dim sum potstickers were to die for!  Atmosphere is awesome - they pack quite a few people in at a time, yet it's still very comfortable and inviting.  The staff is very friendly and the service is fast - the place is so comfortable, I wouldn't even care if it weren't super fast.  If you're in Squirrel Hill and feeling some less-than-typical Asian cuisine, you don't want to miss this one!

YbEQEYXNXJdcRiK_rILsYQ.text: This one of my favorite restaurants in Squirrel Hill. I have tried most of the menu, from the noodle bowls to the soup dumplings and only once did I find an item I didn't care for. The soup I didn't care for was the oxtail soup, due to a large abundance of bones, but the flavor was still fantastic. The noodle bowls are huge so be prepared to eat a lot. The real draw of this place though is the soup dumplings with are exquisite and very cheaply priced. The only drawback of this place is that it gets EXTREMELY crowded sometimes and it can be a long wait for a table.

5KbHzRX52gDi6YaB_Y4Q3g.text: Simple ramen. They can make the soup more flavorful. I think they can do better. Not sure if im coming back. I might just make myself some instant ramen noodles and be creative at home.

gsxC2R4NzGZqhfHFRp_phQ.text: I love this place. It's always busy and for good reason. The soap is large but amazing. The make all their noodles from scratch and you can see them pulling them behind the glass. I always go for the cucumber salad and eat 3 trays of pork soup dumplings. I'll even get soup and cucumbers to go. Their onion pancake is comforting and filling. I always find an excuse to go with my sister and have taken any friend who has never been there to share an experience.

LN2MYNsr-iJJEVU0aPuWtA.text: We came here as we saw that they had good reviews for soup dumplings. We did take out instead of dine in which might have influenced what we ordered. We ordered the drunken chicken, two rice entrees, something else that I don't remember and dumplings. The drunken chicken was delicious! It was tender and had great flavors. As for my rice dish, I wasn't too big of a fan. Initially I wanted to order the soup noodle version but decided against it since I was doing take out. The rice was dry and there was more rice than meat. My least favorite dish were the dumplings. I'm used to dumplings shaped like dumplings but these looked like they were melted.   Overall, this place is not bad but I would want to try the soup dumplings and their noodles for next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rice dishes, drunken chicken and dumplings
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Drunken chicken, dumplings, rice dish

5EgKkGbbo3LmQ99RA4Fijg.text: I love this place so stinkin much - soupy dumps are gr8 so is the woooodear mushroom and wow everything its a blast - it all comes out at random times and then ur table is full of lil goodies and where to put those elbows - uh not on a table full of edible gold - anywho yea give it a go get some jellyfish in u

R0dlkM0qUz1DahLK6FTJfA.text: This is my favorite place to go with people who are visiting from out of town, always a crowd pleaser and always delicious. BYOB, fun ordering system, delicious snacks ranging from small to large, reasonable price point - the honest best food. Everyday noodles has wowed our friends from NYC, PDX, SF etc. the soup dumplings are amazing, love the spicy braised beef soup, best scallion pancakes, been trying to try something different on every visit and have not yet hit on something we didn't like. The dry noodle section is also full of delicious snacks at a smaller price point - dan dan, spicy wonton, minced pork - I'm a big fan of the thin flour noodles. If you were waiting to go, stop waiting to go.

T1dwByqkGqEYoZUqb_L9cw.text: I've been here a few times and haven't reviewed yet because I'm always on the fence about something.   The food is good and the place has a lot to offer, but somehow it always just seems a little off - hence the middle of the road review.    The biggest problem is that the pace of service is consistently a little awkward.  You order all at once on a paper card and then food just starts coming.   There appears to be no rhyme or reason to which dishes come out when - it's just whenever each dish is ready.   So you end up with a random collection of plates and not a lot of room to arrange them on the table - and the order never really makes sense.  You almost have to family style it - otherwise, you might be done before your companions get any of their selections.    The house made noodles are good and it is fun to watch them pull the dough, but you can't actually see it from most of the seats in the house.  I like the BYOB and typically choose dim sum over noodle bowls just to get a little variety.  Their dumplings are fresh and flavorful. If you can get over the randomness of the service, you'll enjoy the food.

n16MFSfIR-3A8wY5kPqi0A.text: My vegan meal at Everyday Noodles was on a par with Apteka. Everything was very fresh and clean and flavorful.   It was refreshing to have nourishing food in PGH after several disappointments!

d3uiomJvxGkGfE_lJXD-2A.text: Ordered spicy beef and tendon noodle soup.  Noodles are great, confused why there is broccoli in it since everything else seems pretty authentic. Why no leafy greens? Also, not spicy at all and a little tendon heavy.  Had about 2/3 tendon 1/3 beef.

YUWLn2Qf3PCLr0FpN8dCtg.text: Simply put, Everyday Noodles is my favorite place to eat in all of Pittsburgh. It has a crave-able quality that makes you keep coming back. Order the PORK SOUP DUMPLINGS at least once before you die! If you don't, you will surely leave this earth without experiencing something so overwhelmingly umami that you will be sad you never slapped your momma.

6PdATzGbadsVYBVv95UgVw.text: Absolutely the best place around for Chinese food.  The soup dumplings are the iconic meal here, but isn't a single thing on the menu that isn't fantastic. From the dan dan noodles to the onion pancakes, everything is packed with flavor.  The staff is very friendly and attentive.  Even if the place is busy, you generally wont wait too long for a seat, as everything moves quickly.  Even the food comes out at a remarkable pace.  It is a very professionally run establishment.  Its worth traveling up here from the South Hills.

gAqwUu3wky_RL1RbmLlEqQ.text: We ordered soup dumplings, marinated beef shank, shu Mai, minced beef noodle, and wonton noodle. The soup dumplings were great, but the rest were not. The wonton was made wrong. Wonton has only pork and shrimp in it but they substituted the shrimp with leek. The shu mai doesn't have much flavor. The minced beef noodle was also different from original. Overall Meh = 3/5. Only can recommend the soup dumplings.  Edit: the noodle alone was great! It is fresh and chewie.

oS8FUSUf2C2WxrDOIYgS-g.text: excellent authentic Chinese noodle and dumpling  restaurant.  20 minutes wait time.  it is totally worth it.  cannot believe that Pittsburgh has such an authentic chinese noodle place.

oRdNlrV5fZ58nnHbgZkHgA.text: *repost from old account* 10/2/17  I come here all the time. It's my go to comfort food that doesn't make me ill--many Chinese restaurants don't sit so well with my stomach. My only complaint is once the waitress told me the dishes incorrectly which led to someone with dietary restrictions eating something they shouldn't have.   Definitely get the pork soup dumplings!

PsAb3GVo_eTNxHDRrTYS7Q.text: Hidden gem in Squirrel Hill. Excellent handmade noodles and fantastic soup dumplings. Don't miss out!

9JI4yQSDt-HZb-fm3a6uPA.text: Great staff that tries to help anyway they can. Food is exceptional. Be adventurous and you will be pleasantly surprised.

Y96faKVg-XNPkhyS9cHBhg.text: TLDR: great noodle soups at fair price points. Service is good, ambiance is great. Highly recommend Taiwanese beef noodle soup for an authentic taste of Taiwanese cuisine, otherwise chicken noodle soup is a great choice.  I often come to Everyday Noodles for the noodle soups, which I personally think are better prepared and more value than their other noodle dishes. I ordered the Chicken Noodle Soup with thin noodles (not the American dish) and was once again served the familiar, flavorful noodles in their light but umami-ful chicken broth. I would however, caution against their  (soup dumplings) as I haven't had too many good experiences with it - usually due to a lack of soup or the skin being too thick.  The service and ambiance are A-tier. I would recommend sitting in front of the kitchen to see the masters at work.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Fj1SZpEOz3wwxoxbMiDYOQ.text: Great noodle place! I recommend beef and chicken noodles. Xiaolongbao is good too. Don't like the beef rice bowl.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

n4rdRnngI96I0k2ifN_Zxw.text: If you want breakfast food, go to Eggyday Noodles.To dine by the river, I recommend Estuary Noodles. And if you wanna see a stage production about how the nation is being lied to and manipulated, try Edgyplay Noodles. If you want a place to pull your Greyhound Bus into at the terminal, try Emptybay Noodles. And if you are feeling horny, try Entryway Noodles. But this is none of these.  What to get: Mango Milk Tea w/ Pudding and Lychee Jelly. What not to get: A drink much better than your friend's because it might make them jelly. What else: Where did that cute Mango?  How to improve: Offer small sizes in bubble teas, and make them a slightly better product.  Erryday Noodles is not the kind of place I'd come erryday, especially not for Bubble Tea because, well, I don't want my stomach to be the size of Pittsburgh. I have yet to try their food but one of these days, I shall.  At first I was going to give them 5 stars for bubble tea, but over the year or two since I first tried it, I've had a thousand bubble teas and my taste has become somewhat more refined. All I can say now is that it's good, but not amazing. I'd put several (including Love Yogurt, I-Tea and Sumi's) significantly ahead of it in the Burgh Bubble Battles.  Speaking of Bubbles, the tapioca itself in here is a bit rubber and tasteless even though the drinks are pretty good. Milk tea is average but some of the other products taste better, such as Mango Milk with Pudding and Lychee Jelly. I do like the prices, which are larger than anywhere in the area, and for less money. I also love the service at EN, which is always friendly, prompt, and courteous.   And if you just came here for a cup of tea, don't bother. You should have gone to Earlgrey Noodles.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. You don&#39;t see bubble tea this tall everyday. You don&#39;t see a noodle as skinny as this straw everyday either. Hopefully.
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Thank goodness I found my bubble tea! Would you like some?
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. I feel like I come here everyday

5djznCd-PdkfM9zSzESI4Q.text: Best noodles in Pittsburgh. The broth is perfection. Similar quality to a noodle restaurant in China(which is good). I cant stop coming here to eat.

C7G_Um2Nzc8BpCuot3Eytw.text: Hand made noddles, and you can watch them make them! This place seemed pretty authentic and the wait was not even 20 minutes for 4 people. You order by circling what you want on the menu. I got the braised beef noodle soup. Big portion, noddles were great, but beef seemed fatty, and I wish there were more vegetables. You can order a side though and they seemed huge.  I've never had soup dumplings and they had it here so we placed an order but we got something that I wasn't expecting, but it was so good! We ordered wrong and got the pork and vegetable potstickers. All the dumplings were together in 1 which was kind of a pain.  Food came out really fast.  They had a few vegetarian/ vegan options but our vegan friend was not impressed.  Friendly service.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Braised beef noodle soup

Vcel6_0vxq8RW6IHXyOayA.text: This place is amazing! When you arrive they give your kid some dough to play with and your able to watch the soup dumplings and noodles being hand made. We had pork soup dumplings, Dan Dan sechuan, and pot stickers. Everything was fantastic.

MmLyCE5xkF1ZYNBvwaJ2aA.text: Dim sum is great here.   The noodles are awful though. There is no flavor in the actual noodles and they have bad texture.   I guess it's nice to see them make it live in the kitchen behind a glass wall. Ambiance is good as well.   Boba is eh.

ogsk2WQ_lxalfuyZi7TrAg.text: Everyday Noodles is known for making homemade noodles in front of all the customers... and they do NOT disappoint! The pork and vegetable soup dumplings were the best dumplings I've ever had, and the pork belly slider was also incredible. For my entree, I split the beef noodle soup, and there was even enough for us both to have leftovers! I can't say enough good things about my meal. I would definitely recommend coming here and getting something with noodles. I'm already looking forward to coming back!

J5A0-FYYfcUXIbrHSfypwg.text: Crack! It's the real deal!!! The dining room is small and the wait may get a little long but it's totally worth it. We're Chinese, originally from Hong Kong. My husband was hesitant at first but one taste and he was sold. Their Bubble Tea has Kung Fu Tea beat. We ordered Shu Mai, Pork Soup Dumplings, Beef Tendon and Minced Pork with thin noodles. My 4 year olds loved the dumplings and noodles.

FjgkY7Y_A_snZCm9gt2NcQ.text: Food services fast even when the restaurant is crowded. So that's bonus. But in general, I think the rating or reputation of this place is higher than reality. Food looks good, tastes okay though. Not as good as several Asian restaurants near PITT Campus. A fair score of 3. I could find or cook similar food. Won't visit again. But it's worth trying to know its standard.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

TCmDLbPKFS5NwIxNKeNGjA.text: Lunch is solved.  Everyday Noodles is a bustling traditional style noodle house located on busy Forbes Ave in Squirrel Hill.  Walking into the shop reminded me of hip, clean, and comforting places in Japan and Korea.  The friendly staff quickly came over greeting us and getting our drink orders.  As per the norm I went with hot tea and water.  The jasmine tea is served in the newer cheesecloth tea bag and is very good.  The food though is why many of you are reading this review and here goes: We shared the potstickers which were legit.  No frozen dumplings steamed in a microwave.  These were hand made then straight up stuck to an earthen pot and steamed traditionally so that you get the crispy starch strewn between each delicious dumpling.  If that wasn't enough I had a hankering for some broth.  I ordered the braised beef & tendon noodle soup with the wide flat noodles.  The broth was rich yet clean, full of flavor and balance.  The handmade noodles had the perfect chew and the portion was too much (not a complaint).  You then must know that the meat was plentiful and flavorful.  Thin slices of beef and chewy chunks of satisfying tendons floated in the amazing broth.  Prices are right too.

wNtGZlX8_frTC9fdKBy97g.text: My Taiwanese friend and her husband took me to this yummy place for freshly made dumplings and noodles. We ordered so much food because we were so hungry. They were surprised to know that we don't have high quality steamed dumplings in Chicago, so this is really a treat!  Spicy dumplings were so good and came with some rice noodles Steamed dumplings are very good and so soupy.  Snow pea sprouts are very good and good portion.  Beef noodle soup was decent 4/5 star Fried tofu was a surprise because it's not greasy and it's egg tofu!  We ordered red bean pancake for dessert and it was 5 star!!  If I come back to Pittsburgh again, I will make sure to visit this place. Definitely come early or you'll have to wait because it's a small place. Would love to try their bubble tea next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef and tendon noodles
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy dumplings
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Snow pea sprouts with pork

NJxbEt2LM-vO6eV5krtpsA.text: Many of my friends keep raving about Everyday Noodles so much that I finally agreed to try the place out. We had to wait for close to 30 minutes even in a random Monday night. We were a group of four.  We got six plates for the four of us. We got the drunken chicken, the pork soup dumplings, vegetable pork potstickers, and pork belly bun as appetizers. The drunken chicken was unexpectedly cold. The pork belly bun was so so delicious! It's pork belly after all. I found the potstickers a little too greasy. The soup dumplings are a must try - I have no idea how they make those things. The dumplings are so juicy that they just call them soup dumplings.  Besides the dim sum, we got the shrimp pork wonton noodle soup and the hot and spicy wonton noodle. The noodle soup was really bland compared to the spicy noodle. I would highly recommend the latter.  Three among us got Thai iced teas, with different toppings. Unfortunately they were out of tapioca bubbles. I found the coconut topping better than grass and Mango pudding.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu

i7sBEZocjeDtTy-sbibmxA.text: Everyday noodles was a peasant surprise for travelers who were dreading their trip back to the Philadelphia area.  Google recommended this place AND the yelp rating was solid.  The place is relatively small but has an extensive menu catering to traditional Chinese food as well as American tastebuds.    I haven't seen wood ear on a menu - like ever except overseas (I guess I should eat at more Chinese restaurants in 'Murca ?).  Anywho, I ordered those (they were accompanied by tofu skin), beef & tendon stew, & my boy toy's Xiao mai (pronounced sha-ow my).    I thought we would have to order more but that was actually enough for two people!!  Our waitress was awesome and we were given a little seat for the little person with us.  P.S. the noodles were PERFECT ... they deserve their own review.

qCe12PUuThEGU1qD2p2I-A.text: We always order too much food and leave so full!  Seriously, the soup dumplings blew my mind - there is soup INSIDE the dumpling- how magical is that? And the taste is delicious.  Get the beef and tendon soup with the wide noodles - so delicious. Don't make a rookie mistake and order too many dumplings/apps they give you so much food you'll roll out of there full and with leftovers.  It's really a neat place where you can watch them handmake the noodles - it's really cool and the food is delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Braised beef and tendon soup - so good
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The most delicious and mind blowing Soup dumplings!

hJgppvhSucJGGPSED7Bptw.text: I always tend to show up right around 2:15 and they stop lunch service at 2:30. Thankfully, they always find me a table even when the restaurant is packed full. Service in incredibly fast. I'm always in and our in about 30 minutes.   Half of the enjoyment I get from Everyday Noodles is from watching the chefs make the noodles. They swing around an enormous rope of dough and bang it on a counter which is a bit loud and surprising, but adds to the charm of the place.   The soup dumplings are good - I had them a few times in China and these are very similar in quality and flavor. I really enjoy the pickled cucumber, green onion pancakes, dan dan noodles,   and egg yolk buns. The noodles soups are also very tasty, of course! Definitely recommend Everyday Noodles for an authentic experience.

RONBRGbKDMOyBZmNtpfIxA.text: YES.   Yes to the efficient service, yes to the noodle maker, yes to the menu of awesome soup dumplings and soup noodles and rice dishes and desserts. Yes yes yes a thousand times yes.  I ordered the oxtail noodle soup - with hand tossed wide noodles and chunky pieces of meat. Served with a giant spoon with a perfectly light broth with a chock full of green onion... drank up the entire bowl.   My friend ordered the hot and spicy wonton, which is definitely on the hotter and spicier side. Beware! She also thoroughly enjoyed her thai iced tea & condensed milk cream donuts.   Sometimes simple is the best... my comfort food made right. :D ahhh love it.

neZv-XqHC_SnoIwuVo6dsA.text: Loved it. It's already gotten so many good reviews which speaks for itself.   We ordered all the good stuff: xiaolongbao, beef wrap, noodle soups (zha jiang mien and beef noodles and oxtail) and it was totally worth it to wait a bit to eat here. We relished it and I wouldn't mind coming back.

Vk1IaT4mFQXb8Qok7w4wNg.text: Pretty good for Pittsburgh. The texture of the noodles is great, and it's also great fun to watch them make the noodles. Soup dumplings, pork belly bun here are decent. Some of the dim sum options are a little inconsistent (sometimes skin is a little thick, inconsistent fillings). But for the price point and taste it's a great place to get your fix of noodles! Also despite being a noodle place, their bubble tea is one of the better options in the area.

S1dYOFnwzg7I6gA-3Oi0Ww.text: My go-to place for dimsum whenever I'm back in the Burgh. The XiaoLongBao (little dumplings with soup in them) are absolutely AMAZING. As good as it gets. You really can't go wrong ordering any of the dumplings or buns. I also like their dry noodles a lot (DanDan, Sesame, etc.). Great texture - just chewy enough! The flavoring is also spot on.  While the restaurant is quite small and always packed (it's that popular), I love that they allow you to watch the chefs make noodles. If you've never seen this before, I highly encourage you to go to Everyday Noodles to check it out. It really makes you appreciate the craftsmanship that goes behind the noodles in your bowl.

Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

QnhbOhWe_L2i-9aMN-Nxsw.text: The soup dumplings are the best at everyday noodles... The Dan Dan noodles are very tasty and spicy. I always crave this place!!!!

DyPN5Rp4MRph5b42Moc1gA.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this place.  It is not easy to find authentic Shanghai soup dumplings (xiaolongbao) that aren't too thick/doughy/stuck together and Everyday Noodles hits the mark.  If they would expand to Cincinnati I would be a happy camper and probably visit weekly for the xiaolongbao alone.     I was a little less impressed with some of the other menu offerings: seaweed wasn't good, the boba milk tea tasted off (both the milk and the tea were off) and the soup I tried was not memorable.  But that is easily forgiven - if you come here for the soup dumplings you will not be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Z6R24_m69rwHF27TTOL6hA.text: After seeing many good reviews about this place I wanted to give it a go. The place itself is quite cozy and small and looks inviting. Staff is really  nice and welcoming, but from there it unfortunately went downwards for me.  I had the shrimp and pork wonton soup and I was quite disappointed. The wontons itself were nice, but the soup just bland. The only thing that gave it some flavor was pepper. I like the fact that the noodles are made freshly on site and you can even watch the chefs preparing them. But for me this just didn't do the trick. It tasted like wontons in hot water with a bit of pepper and 2 small pieces of broccoli that were still raw. I don't know. Maybe I am spoiled from NY and many other places were the broth is just nice and rich, with plenty of veggies and fresh spices. Maybe their specialty are the wontons and dumplings. I would give them another try for the dumplings, but don't expect me to come back soon!

U4J_yedRxbXVSDrJCOjx1w.text: A favorite go too especially for their noodle soups and especially got the soup dumplings. Fun to watch them making the noodles.  I've never anything less than fresh, tasty food. Often, I do take out- always arrives well packaged and hot

vR57L1q4Hq76OzbI9duWgw.text: My first time here was an amazing experience. Each dish was full of flavor. Service was fast and attentive. The Taiwanese style pork belly slider almost had me in tears at getting to experience. Amazing flavor with the food showing up fast.

Z0YsjJVttAckzqjfliixXw.text: Who doesn't love Everyday Noodles? Pretty much everything is good here. And, it's BYOB :) the spicy wonton noodles is my fav.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Wcex9unK1xtN4LTKGDViOg.text: This place is excellent. I've only been here two times, but the food has been delicious each time. So far the soup dumplings were my favorite. You can't go wrong with anything you try.

cH35cQDrEkKC7cwTqQVzuw.text: Nothing spectacular or hype deserving. I had the soup dumplings and braised beef noodles. The soup dumplings were underwhelming. The "skin" was too hard, thick and dry. The soup was average. The beef noodles were slightly spicy, taste was okay, but nothing special.   Shared a pan fried pork dumpling and BBQ pork bun with my boyfriend. Don't even bother with the pork dumpling. But the bun was recommendable.   My boyfriend had a dandan noodle. Nothing special about that too. It was underwhelming.  The milk tea did not taste like actual milk tea you'd get from Asia. I had high hopes for the milk tea because the people working there sounded Taiwanese. So I was hoping for some authentic Taiwanese milk tea. It tasted like every other westernised milk tea in all the other Chinese restaurants.   All in all, over priced Chinese food that really isn't that great. But that's pretty much what you can get in Pittsburgh.

2ZBiZqYSQ9hsJAPYFIywBQ.text: Really like the restaurant because their food is really similar to the authentic Taiwanese food! We order the chicken soup and it was my fav! The bubble tea with grass jelly was really good too.  We got a seat By the kitchen and the chef was making the noodle right Infornt of us which was pretty cool. The food over all was pretty good. I willl definitely come back again:)

f8iail96ed8q-SV-DyVPYw.text: I was between a 3 and a 4 for this place. I've come here multiple times now and have tried the following: beef and tendon noodle soup, pork belly slider, soup dumplings, pork belly and rice, various dry noodles, and scallion pancake.  My main complaint is that the noodle soup was really salty each time I tried it. I thought the first time might have been a fluke but it doesn't seem to have been the case. I'm generally someone who likes my food on the salty side and even this was too salty for me.  The pork belly slider was okay but next time, I would probably order it without peanuts, as I didn't like how the texture went with the rest of the slider.  The soup dumplings were good, and I really liked the scallion pancake. I'll definitely order the scallion pancake if I come here again - they're crispier and thicker (with more layers) than most places make them.

n0ci8REWUPPOxDKTOz6I9A.text: Wonderful! Nothing like the usual Americanized chinese restaurants. Soups are incredible and vegetables are fresh. I will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Great food!

OnQdZDCe-RMpa07ou__r1g.text: First time i had soup dumplings.  Gotta say they were yummy!   Also had potstickers and buns.   The buns were the best.   I dont usually eat pasta at all,  but i truley enjoyed myself here.   The potstickers were kind of open,  not what I'm used to,  but tasty and well done none the less.   The steamed bun was crispy on top and too too yummy. Soup dumplings were hot little bastards but flaverful and fun (try not to burn your mouth).  Poke a hole in the little guy before you eat him so the lava contained therein has a chance to simmer down.

SiFBTHB_7Ie4oqNEUO0o8w.text: Super good lunch spot! We walked in and were immediately seated. They have little papers for you to mark what you want off the menu, and the food came really fast after we placed our order.  We had the pork soup dumplings, green onion pancakes, pork belly slider, and braised beef noodle soup. All were super delicious. They make their own noodles right in front of you and the flavors are amazing. Some of the dishes can be spicy, but we liked the heat and the extra flavor it gave them.   Their bubble tea is also delicious. Tried the mango milk tea with tapioca pearls and it was the perfect amount of sweet for me.   Overall, would definitely recommend!

H2cjsQXEWeKwP1mIIwTScQ.text: We love everyday noodle for their pork soup dumplings- they are a must have. Today we tried the chicken noodle soup- that had full piece of chicken with bones in them. We also had the bubble tea which is always a treat. The Bok Choy is delicious with the oyster sauce. The one and only disappoint was the crab dumplings ( just would never ever get them over the pork ones) not the same. Overall awesome place!

_txLLusRPkhsffLlDSKCUA.text: We ordered their Dan Dan noodle and it wasn't authentic at all. The flavor profile was completely off; supposed to be spicy + a bit sweet over minced meat sauce and peanut but it was overpowered with fake peanut sauce. That was disappointing. Also tried their soupy dumplings and it was quite dry. The best soupy dumplings are supposed be transparent in looks with clear, juicy soup...Overall, nice try of everyday noodle but it's just not quite there yet. Authentic Chinese food scene in Pittsburgh need SOS!!

95RruxEN0W0TpnAbLXuH6Q.text: The taste is very good.  recommend:,,! There are still lots of dishes I haven't tried yet. But I would definitely go there again and again.  Really good place ! I have been there twice. You have to wait to be seated. The taste is so good that so many people is waiting in line in the lunch or dinner time.   So bring your friends and come early to have a taste. You won't regret!

871cbb2Esv5FzISusSEO-g.text: Omg omg omg. Soup dumplings where have you been all my life.  get the pork soup dumplings. We got the pork and the crab and pork to try and we both preferred the pork but both were wonderful. Also got the tofu nuggets. They were decent but wish we would have just gotten another soup dumplings. Best thing I've tried in a long time. Can't wait to order again and get some more soup dumplings and try some other things. Everything on the menu looks really yummy.

LHKCrI5xI2_D5D-IgnNyuQ.text: Excellent food, especially the freshly made noodle. The chicken soup was amazing for a cold winter night and so as the soup dumplings. Amazing and a must try!

eHVU1GvJMm3M6DX6fZvxAA.text: This place was totally surprising to me. I was like wait...XLB...in Pittsburgh? What?  Also, I happen to love the name. Tian Tian Jian Mian. It totally made me giggle.  In any case, I dined here one weekend while I was visiting friends who are local. We got the pork XLB, noodle soup (I got lamb, she got pickled mustard greens with pork) and the beef scallion roll. Had there been more of us, I'd have ordered more of the smaller stuff but I guess I will have to save those for a future visit.   The food came out quickly and it was all very good. The skins of the XLB were just right -- not too thick or too thin so that they break and you lose the precious liquid gold, I mean, soup.   The lamb noodles in consomme needed some extra kick - so you do have to ask for chili oil as it is not readily accessible on the table.   All in all, a True gem in Pittsburgh land. I'd happily return.

nB3U6C0rCsg6ehx-_XvJCg.text: Friendly staff and delicious food! I live in DC and have tried soup dumplings in the NYC and DMV area. These ones are way better! Closest I have been able to find to the Ding Tai Fung in Taipei. We got the loofah and shrimp, pork, and pork and crab soup dumplings. The loofah and shrimp one wins hands down for me and they're apparently only available on Sundays. We also got the pork belly sliders...delicious but huge portions which is great. I ate all of mine but you should probably plan on sharing with one other person! The beef noodle soup was also great...not too salty or anything tho nothing beats street noodles from the motherland. I enjoyed my meal and would go back for sure!

k-SiFFuqlmH4GFRGKqezoA.text: Unbelievable.   Simply perfect.  If I'm ever on death row, my last meal will be these pork soup dumplings!

4CMCRoNZgmxwtOBLG4I70g.text: Fresher noodles you may not find in this town, I tried the steamed vegetable dumplings and the chicken noodle soup - loved it! But careful the portions are big but the staff box it nicely and it still that's great next day :) Also the mango bubble tea was tasty.

Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Potsticks so good!
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wantan noodle soup

eQqWwfYzHGOe1OXpDmxScw.text: With such predominantly good reviews I tried to keep my expectations low so I wouldn't be disappointed. I went with three friends a bit after noon on a nice Saturday when it was in the low 80's outside. The place was packed and we were told the wait would be around 20 minutes. I am uncomfortable standing for long periods of time, and that makes me cranky, but is also not the fault of the restaurant. After reading reviews I was expecting a wait.  It may have been a bit longer than 20 minutes, but not unreasonably so. I dislike crowded places and commented to my friends that unless the food was awesome, I could only foresee coming back for takeout.  Within minutes of being seated and before we could place our order, the power went out... (entire block, not just an internal problem).  Long story short, the entire staff epitomized grace under pressure. We were told what to expect and that the temperature might start to get uncomfortable with no AC and the kitchen continuing to cook with gas, and that our dishes would be served as soon as completed, perhaps one at a time, so they would be fresh and hot. The food was all delicious, our server and hostess were phenomenal, and this turned out to be one of the best dining experiences in a while. I had the rolled scallion pancakes with sliced beef that had such a tasty sauce, and the pork soup noodles. Also sampled the crab and pork soup noodles and veggie soup noodles. All good. My friends, all much less grumpy people than I am, were also very pleased with their meals and we were all wowed by the service. We'll be back!

M3kqxUPHPFrm12ctLCeiiA.text: We came here on a Friday night, and as expected this place was packed.  We actually had to wait to get a table, but it was a rather short wait of about 5 to 10 minutes as we were told that we would have to wait 20 min or so.   This place has a great ambiance. I love the asian theme and the fact that you can see the cooks stretch out dough to make noodles behind a glass. Pretty cool. They actually have a bar set up right in front so you can see all the action in the kitchen.   The waiters were really knowledgable and had good suggestions for Every Day Noodle virgins like us.  We ended up ordering the shiitake mushrooms and bamboo shoots as apetizers and boy were they good. I really loved the sauce they were in and just how beefy the flavor was. One thing that did surprise me was that this was a cold dish, but a pretty awesome one even if the temperature was unexpected.   I ordered the pork and crab soup dumplings. Now I was actually expecting a soup with dumplings in it, but to my surprise (once more) it was dumplings with soup inside of them!! The waitress was kind enough to educate me on how to eat this dish. She recommended I pick up the dumpling with tongs, place it on my spoon and pinch it to release the soup. Along side the dumplings, came a sauce that looked like soy sauce as well as some shredded ginger. The server recommended i place some ginger in the sauce and place it on atop the dumplings. She then suggested I sip the soup from the spoon and proceed to eat the rest.  Even though eating this dish was a little different, it was so worth it!! The broth was delightful and the dumplings with the pork and crab was just divine. I thoroughly enjoyed this dish, although I was glad to have an appetizer as this dish alone as an entree would not be enough to fill me up.  My husband had the braised beef and tendon soup, which was extremely tasty. The broth in this soup was also incredibly good and the tendons and beef in the soup were oh so tender and tasty!! This dish, although unorthodox for most people, was pretty damn good. This dish was definetely filling, and I had a bit of this dish as I was a little hungry after having my soup dumplings.  Overall, our whole experience was extremely positive and look forward to returning. Everything that we tried was excellent and the customer service was pretty good and efficient. Definitely a good place to hit up for a cold night.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bamboo and shitake mushrooms

Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Soup dumplings

L4t36UTEoKjYZ34Tu14e_A.text: My delivery finally arrived after more than two hours. It was cold, and they got the order size wrong.

mRYu5y5rG5tKwUXbAjERXQ.text: My personal favorite restaurant I. Squirrel Hill. The noodle bowls are delicious, but the soup dumplings are my fave. Everytime we come to Pittsburgh, it's a must visit for a meal or two.wish there was something like this near us in NJ.

S-f8FJDtY9Wdi9Mx_8bM5Q.text: The noodles here are top-notch. Very fresh! You're able to watch them make noodles through the glass they have installed so you can watch while you wait to be seated. The look of the restaurant is quite nice...well-lit, clean, and modern looking.  However, I have 2 very big qualms with this establishment: their lack of flexibility in food options. I do not eat pork for cultural reasons and when I asked to substitute the wontons in one of the dishes from shrimp and pork to just vegetables the waitress said they can't do that. I do not understand why, they're already making vegetable wontons, why not throw those in?!  Regardless, what I ended up ordering was...okay. I ordered the Taiwanese Style Sesame Cold Noodles with chicken tossed in a peanut vinegar sauce, which tasted fresh and crisp up top with the chicken however, as I worked through the dish it began to taste very vinegary and at one point like straight up peanut butter.   Another problem I have with this establishment is that they do not label well. The first time I came here I ordered the Shiitake Mushroom and Bamboo Shoot noodle soup, thinking it was the only vegetarian soup option. While it tasted great, I found out this past visit that the soup is PORK BASED. I could not believe something like that wasn't labeled on the menu! Vegetarians be wary coming here, please be sure to ask you waiter/waitress if there is any meat-based stock or any meat in the food you wish to order. Especially because there are no substitutions!  Bottom Line: If you're a meat eater, I bet this will please your taste buds, as for people who have dietary restrictions or are vegetarians, be careful! Prices are beyond fair, super cheap for a good deal of food.

buXm1CG9Xpz8Vt4Z86d5HQ.text: After reading the reviews I had to come and try it. I was impressed!!  We started with an appetizer of shrimp and pork wontons. They came to our table quickly. From first bite to last they were wonderful. The hubby ordered Spicy Beef Noodle Soup. It was ok but I liked what I ordered better. I had the shrimp and pork dumplings. They were little pieces of heaven. Can't wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp and Pork dumplings
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork wontons
Photo of Everyday Noodles - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy Beef Noodle soup

wa1FwZt2F-yBkEzR77iwWg.text: We make a point of going here when we are in town.  Everything we've had here is amazing, and it is a lot of fun to watch them make the noodles.  The chefs here are trained in Taiwan.  It does get very busy.

TgNYd_X3KipiYANorbeH-w.text: Delicious, delicious, delicious!  We stopped in this afternoon after going to a birthday party a few stores down the street, and were very pleased we did. Given the positive vibes on this site, we figured it was very much time to dive headfirst into this experience...  Owner was on-site today, and despite my feelings about Tamari, this place gave us the exact opposite experience - excellent service, excellent and inspired food, and overall a great quick Sunday family meal.  We really enjoyed watching the guys make dumplings and noodles; the open kitchen concept really highlights the culinary virtuosity these guys bring to this place.  Our selections really were mostly "dim sum" type things - pork soup dumplings, shrimp with loofah soup dumplings, pork pot stickers, a pan-fried scallion pancake, and an order of cold sesame noodles - for the 2.5 of us (little one was in-tow today...) I was truly taken aback to see how much food that got us (Yes, Rachel C., you hit the nail on the head - we have lots of delicious leftovers now!). All for around $40!  Great service - our waiter was efficient and friendly, and even brought out utensils and a bowl for our little one, without us having to ask!   Yes, yes, yes... we will be back! (Very soon, I think!) Looking forward to trying other dishes from this rather large and interesting menu!

vAckaF8n0KKJeqHOnb1ayw.text: Here's why I don't write reviews for Chinese restaurants: I have to look up their English names...   It's so popular that I didn't try it until recently. The bubble tea here is really good. It's pricier than the one in Rose tea, but you also get more.  I like that noodles with pork sauce. I've tried both the thin and wide/thick noodles. The wide one is less chewy and are kind of sticky. I prefer the thin one for this dish. Dan dan noodles are different from what I was expecting. My friend liked it but it's just okay for me. The noodle with wonton is flavorless to me.  The soup dumplings are good but not amazing. If you've never had it before, give it a try and you probably will like it. I'd like to try noodles with beef soup next time.  The appetizers are too pricy in my opinion. I won't pay $6 for a small plate of vegetables again...  The owner is a nice guy and I enjoyed chatting with him a little bit during dinners.

ooQzsZiFciwTfRTZH3eEjw.text: Overall: I would definitely recommend eating at this restaurant!  The food here is yummy, but a little pricy.!    So far, this is the best place that I have found to eat taiwanese style noodles and xiao long baos!  It is more expensive than in other cities, which have an abundance of these type of restaurants, but it's worth it.  I'd recommend ordering:  *Beef Noodle Soup *Xiao Long Bao's *Beef Rolls (my favvvvvvvv choice at these types of restaurants, although again, the portion is pretty small at Everyday Noodle) *Zha Jiang mian  Usually I like thick noodles, but I think I prefer the thin noodles at Everyday Noodle.  I haven't tried the dumplings or bubble tea yet, but I can't wait to go back and try more of their menu.

JIbavO5isVuq1je5ygJIOw.text: really bad service and arrogant waitress. Won't come again. Your service really ruin my mood.

PvGaACgMA0bChUGg4zNUJQ.text: As a Taiwanese living in Pittsburgh, Everyday Noodles is where I go to find some comfort in food.   Pork soup dumplings is a MUST order, I took all my friends who aren't used to Asian cuisine there and they all loved it - the demonstration window where you can see how they make the noodles and dumplings is pretty entertaining also.   My second favorite dish there is the dry spicy wanton noodle - pretty close to home and is "actually" spicy. Personally I prefer their dry noodles over soups, I wasn't too impressed with their noodle soups.   If you are into beef tendons like me, then make sure you try their Marinated Beef Tendon - I found it hard to find a place that serves decent beef tendon in Pittsburgh - the tendon pieces are usually too chopped up and thin, and not flavorful enough. The ones from Everyday Noodle is pretty delish compared to the other places.  The only downside is it is slightly pricey for students, compared to some other Asian restaurants, but once in a while it is a good treat!

WFZ0pOfNoyF8usU3p2qi_w.text: I was generally impressed with the overall experience here. I was greeted with the loud slapping of the fresh noodles they were making. The watercress with pork was tasty, but the main star was the pork and crab soup dumplings. 4 stars because I felt the soup dumplings could use more soup.... Maybe I'm just spoiled because I just ate some unbeatable soup dumplings in Philadelphia 's Chinatown. Who knows...
